Content: RISHIKESH: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday said deadly diseases like coronavirus can be eliminated by regularly practising yoga Inaugurating the week-long International Yog Festival in Rishikesh , Yogi said one who remains fit through yoga need not fear diseases like coronavirus. “The Indian tradition needs to be understood more deeply as it has tremendous things to offer through yoga. The world is waging a war against mental and physical illnesses. If these are cured, then no one will suffer from blood pressure, heart attack, kidney failure, liver failure or even coronavirus for that matter,” he added.Yogi claimed that Japanese encephalitis has gone down by 60% and mortality due to it dipped by 90% in the last two years. He said, “For the past 40 years, I have noticed that around 1,500 children of ages 1 to 15 die during the monsoon season due to encephalitis. Through my fight against the disease in Gorakhpur and eastern UP for the past 25 years, I have come to the conclusion that prevention is the only cure in such cases.”

Title: SSB commandos to join anti-Red operations in Bihar
Content:
There are altogether 10 such teams in the state, which will be deployed in Maoist-hit districts on the directi... Read More

PATNA: In a fresh bid to flush out Maoists from the state, the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) has decided to deploy its highly trained commandos in Red-hit districts to work in tandem with police.

A decision to this effect was taken at a joint meeting of senior officials of the SSB, state police and central intelligence agencies at Muzaffarpur on Saturday.

Sharing details of the meeting, IG, SSB frontier headquarters in Patna, Sanjay Kumar said on Sunday that the members of small action team (SAT) of the SSB would assist the Bihar police in anti-Maoist operations.

The IG said the SAT commandos, who were imparted special training in greyhound and jungle warfare, had won accolades in Jharkhand for their tremendous success in anti-Maoist operations.

There are altogether 10 such teams in the state, which will be deployed in Maoist-hit districts on the directive of the state police headquarters. The SSB has already deployed two battalions comprising 18 companies in Bihar for security of its border with Nepal and other security related affairs and anti-Maoist operations.

In neighbouring Jharkhand, two more battalions of the SSB were engaged in special drive against Red rebels. In Bihar, the SSB personnel were cooperating with the police officers in Jamui, Gaya, Lakhisarai, Aurangabad, Muzaffarpur and Munger districts. “Highly trained commandos who are below the age of 30 years, professional and motivated, are being deployed in Bihar for the first time,” the IG said.

ADG (law & order) Amit Kumar, who represented the state police at the meeting, said only four districts – Gaya, Jamui, Aurangabad and Munger – in the state witness Maoist activities. “The rebel outfit has no influence or support base in north Bihar now,” he claimed.

IG, SSB, however, admitted that Red rebels still have their influence in some pockets under Bagaha subdivision in West Champaran district and riverine belt in some districts such as Vaishali.

The meeting also discussed at length the measures to curb the incidents of drug trafficking and human trafficking along Indo-Nepal border. The officials also admitted that the gangs involved in narcotics and liquor smuggling have become more active in border districts after enforcement of total prohibition in the state.

"Though prohibition was earlier not on our agenda, it became important as reports of liquor smuggling from Nepal poured in from time to time, " SSB's IG said. The SSB claimed to have seized around five lakh litres of liquor ever since the state was declared 'dry' in April 2016.

IG, Tirhut range, Ganesh Kumar, SSP of Muzaffarpur Jayant Kant and SPs of Sitamarhi and Madhubani also attended the meeting.

Title: Bihar Mahotsav ends
Content:
PATNA: The three-day Bihar Mahotsav in Ahmedabad, aimed at introducing the rich and diverse culture of the state to outsiders, concluded on a positive note on Sunday.

Thousands of people thronged the Tagore Memorial Hall, where the fair-cum-exhibition with 26 stalls was organized. The stalls showcased the popular handicrafts, tourist spots, agricultural innovations, food items and small scale industries of Bihar.

Local folk artistes from Bihar also performed at the three-day fest. “The third and the last day of Bihar Mahotsav witnessed a dance-drama christened ‘Rhythm of Bihar’ and performances by Maithili Thakur and Priyanka. Several people from different parts of Gujarat visited the stalls and enjoyed the performances,” an official of the Bihar art, culture and youth affairs department said.

Meanwhile, art, culture and youth affairs department minister Pramod Kumar said Bihar Mahotsava had also been organized in cities like New Delhi, Kolkata, Goa and Jaipur in the past. “In a bid to commemorate the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, we decided to celebrate Bihar Mahotsav in the state he was born. Moreover, Gandhi, who started his journey in Gujarat, got the title of Mahatma in Bihar’s Champaran,” he said.

The minister added that the event amalgamated the culture, tradition and art of both states with performances from Bihar and Gujarat artists. “Be it cultural programmes, handicrafts exhibition or authentic delicacies, the rich diversity of Bihar was on full display,” he said.

Several stalls of tourism department, Bihar Museum, Jeevika, Upendra Maharathi Shilp Anusandhan Sansthan and Sangeet Natak Academy did good business at the festival.

Pawan Kumar Priyadarshi, project manager (communications) of Jeevika, said stalls of ‘Didi ki Rasoi’ and Madhubani paintings were the most sought after at the Mahotsav. “Altogether seven stalls of jewellery, vases and Madhubani painting were set up by Jeevika. The famous ‘Didi Ki Rasoi’ lured people with its delicacies like ‘litti-chokha’. Besides, a stall for showcasing Bihar’s small scale industries was also set up,” he said.

Title: Six booked for liquor party in Mundra village
Content:
Rajkot: Police on Sunday booked six men whose video , in which they are seen dancing and pouring liquor on each other during a marriage function in a village of Mundra taluka of Kutch district, went viral on social media on Saturday.

The accused were identified as Mangalji Jadeja, Pradeepsinh Jadeja, Ramdevsinh Kher, Hardeepsinh Khod, Vijaysinh Jadeja and Mayursinh Jadeja.

“We have ascertained the identities of the accused on the basis of the statements by Mota Kandagara village sarpanch, villagers and members of the musical band that played at the marriage function on the early morning of February 26,” said P K Patel, inspector with Mundra police station.

Patel said it was Mangalji who had organized the party for his son Kuldeepsinh’s marriage. “We have booked the accused under various sections of the Prohibition Act and launched a manhunt for them,” he said.

The video shows over a dozen men dancing with liquor bottles in their hands. One of them is seen pouring liquor on another man’s head, while he continues dancing to the music. Other members of the marriage party, including children are seen watching the act of the adult men. Some men are also seen drinking from the bottles.

STRICT ACTION WILL BE TAKEN AGAINST THE OFFENDERS: RUPANI

Rajkot: Chief minister Vijay Rupani told media persons that those involved in the liquor party in Kutch would not be spared. “Strict action will be taken against the offenders. Such kind of illegal activities will not be tolerated and prohibition will be strictly enforced,” said Rupani here on Sunday.

Title: Whatever you do, do with commitment: Justice MR Shah
Content:
Dignitaries at the stone laying function on Sunday

Rajkot: “Judicial officers should exercise their power to give justice. If they fail to use this power, then they too are party to the injustice , as people come to the courts with their trust in us,” said Supreme Court judge, justice M R Shah , while asking judicial members and advocates to strive towards maintaining people’s trust in the justice delivery system.

“Whatever you do, do with commitment, trust, honesty and integrity,” he said while speaking at the ground breaking ceremony of the new court building in Rajkot on Sunday.

Indicating at the recent Delhi’s riots without naming it, Justice Shah reminded the judicial officers of their huge role in the delivery system and said: “You have seen in our country how things panned out when people took law into their own hands. When people’s trust in judiciary or justice delivery system gets shaken they become impatient. We need to think that why this has happened because people come to the court like they do to temples and we have to work in a way that their faith on justice is not shaken.”

Asking advocates not to go on strikes, he said, “Strike is actually injustice to the public at large. If you have any grievances, then work an extra hour to showcase your anger.” Justice Shah was a member of a bench that recently delivered the judgement holding SC advocates’ strike illegal.

Justice Shah also asked advocates to take the maximum benefits of mediation and alternate dispute resolution system. He also apprised the infrastructure created by state government in various court buildings. “Whatever power and position you got and what trust people has put in you and system, work in a way that that trust stays strong. Justice delivery system sustains only when the people’s trust in justice sustain,” he added.

Chief justice of Gujarat high court Vikram Nath said, “It’s almost six months in Gujarat now and I am finding the government’s cooperation and work culture very good. The judicial system gets tremendous support from the state government to run the judiciary of the entire state.”

The new court building will come in 14 acre land in Ghanteshwar area near FCI warehouse at a cost of Rs 118 crore. Work is expected to end in next two years.

Title: Good response for Palayam market revamp pre-bid meet
Content:
Thiruvananthapuram: Smart City Thiruvananthapuram Limited (SCTL) has received response from five bidders, including those from outside the state, to take up redevelopment of Palayam market . It is one of the key projects being implemented as part of Smart City scheme. SCTL is expecting a consortium of companies to undertake the scheme as three major works have to be executed by the company that will win the bid.

The project involves design, supply and installation of prefabricated structures for constructing the rehabilitation block of existing vendors. Besides site clearance and construction of a new market building, it also involves design, supply, installation and maintenance of electro-mechanical car parking system within the basement of the proposed market building.

Five companies took part in the pre-bid meeting which was held last week. The first two components will be executed at Rs 12.7 crore and Rs 61.05 crore, respectively and the third component will cost Rs 8.17 crore.

SCTL wants three projects to be awarded as a whole so that it can do away with any kind of delay, which generally arises when three works are awarded separately. It will also put the onus on a single party, especially with regard to site clearance and rehabilitation of the vendors. SCTL CEO P Balakiran said he is hopeful of a smooth eviction process as part of temporary rehabilitation of vendors.

Presently, there are 165 fish shops, 20 chicken and meat shops,78 daily needs shops, 37 clothing shops and 94 fruits and vegetables stalls functioning at Palayam market. As part of the redevelopment 490 shops have been proposed in the market, where a four-storied building will come up. The entire project will cover 17,741.96 sq.m.

While inaugurating modernization of Chalai Market under Chalai Heritage Scheme, minister for tourism and devaswom Kadakampally Surendran had said there was so much delay on the part of vendors in rehabilitation, which affected the progress of the work. P Balakiran said the vendors’ concerns would be addressed and a prefab structure will be constructed for temporary rehabilitation.

SCTL is close to finalising the agreement with the firm for bio-mining of legacy waste at Palayam. The dumpyard will be cleared through bio-mining as part of the Smart City project. The temporary rehabilitation block for vendors and shop owners who have to be shifted for the modernisation of Connemara Market is being planned at the dumpyard.

Bio-mining of legacy waste/un-processed municipal solid waste is done by excavation of the non-biodegradable waste using a mechanical sieving machine or any other suitable equipment. Recoverable materials are segregated and recycled for reclamation of dumpsite land.

Title: Robbers target six factories in Junagadh, loot valuables worth Rs 68,000
Content:
Rajkot: A gang of five unidentified robbers targeted six factories and decamped with Rs 62,000 cash and a gold ring worth Rs 6,000 near Keshod bypass in Junagadh district on early Sunday morning.

Police said the robbers who had covered their faces with kerchiefs targeted factories located on the outskirts of Sondarada village on Keshod bypass.

“The robbers first targeted the factory owned by Vijay Rakholia. They threatened Rakholia to kill him, brandishing an axe and a pickaxe, and then they took Rs 28,600 cash from the drawer. They also robbed Rakholia of his gold ring worth Rs 6,000,” said an official from Keshod police station.

The robbers then broke the locks of five other factories and stole cash worth Rs 33,400.

“The robbers took away digital video recorder from Rakholia’s factory which they broke and dumped in a farm. However, they did not damage the CCTVs of the other factories, on the basis of which we have launched an investigation,” added the official.

Title: Woman killed, 15 hurt as SUV overturns
Content:
Rajkot: A woman was killed and 15 others , including four children , were injured when the SUV they were travelling in overturned near RTO circle in Morbi on Sunday.

The deceased was identified as Manju Parmar (32). “All the victims belong to same family. They were going on a pilgrimage to a temple at Khakhravadi village near Morbi. The driver of the SUV apparently lost control over the steering wheel while trying to save a dog, ” said an official from Morbi B division police station.

The injured were first taken to Morbi Civil Hospital and then shifted to Rajkot Civil Hospital.

Title: Dead teachers served show-cause notices in Bihar
Content:
Bihar School Examination Board office in Patna

PATNA: Bizarre it may sound, but two teachers who died more than two years back, were not only assigned the duty to examine answer copies of Intermediate examination but also issued show-cause notices for not showing up at the evaluation centre.

The show-cause notices were issued against two teachers, including Ranjit Kumar Yadav, who used to teach at Shaligrami in Begusarai and died in an accident in 2017. The other teacher was Gulam Haider of Project Balika Uchh Vidyalaya, Katoria in Banka district, who died in 2018.

The letters for the evaluation duty of government schoolteachers were issued by the Bihar School Examination Board (BSEB), which had been forwarded to respective schools through the district education offices. The evaluation of answer copies for Class XII started across the state on February 26.

Begusarai district education officer (DEO) Devendra Kumar Jha told this newspaper over the phone that the BSEB had issued the joining letter of Ranjit, which the DEO office forwarded to respective schools. “Following the direction of the education department, we served show-cause notices to those teachers who failed to join the evaluation duty,” he said.

He added: “After we got to know from our sources that Ranjit died in an accident 2017, we verified it with the school and cancelled the show-cause.”

Education minister Krishna Nandan Prasad Verma said the department would verify the matter. “I’ll talk to Board chairman Anand Kishor to make sure that such incidents won’t happen in future. As per my knowledge, the show-cause letter was cancelled by the DEO,” he told this newspaper on Sunday.

The minister said due to ongoing indefinite strike of niyojit teachers, the Board might have not verified about these two teachers. “However, the evaluation work has been going smoothly. We have assigned 4,000 guest teachers for the evaluation work, which will be finished on time,” Verma said.

Government primary schoolteachers have been on indefinite strike since February 17 whereas niyojit teachers of secondary and higher secondary since February 25. Around 2,500 teachers were served show-cause notices whereas the FIR has been lodged against 1,300 teachers for boycotting the evaluation duty.

Title: Surat: 52, including many women, caught from liquor party on Dumas Road
Content:
Police seize liquor bottles, cars, mobiles phones worth several lakhs from venue

SURAT: Police arrested 52 people , including 13 women , for consuming liquor at a party in a farmhouse on Dumas Road on Saturday night. The accused had gathered to celebrate leap year. Police seized beer tins and three Vodka bottles worth Rs7,000, 14 cars worth Rs97 lakh , 46 mobile phones worth Rs13 lakh and a music system worth Rs30,000 during the raid.

Of the total accused, 39 men were produced in court which remanded them in police custody for a day on Sunday.

Police were tipped off by a local that music was being played loudly and liquor being consumed at the farmhouse. Cops verified presence and consumption of liquor in the farmhouse before carrying out the raid.

"When we reached there, we noticed that several cars were parked outside and music was being played loudly. We found that liquor was being consumed at the party after which we detained those present there. We later sent them for medical examination to verify if they were drunk," said a police officer of Dumas police station.

Police investigation revealed that Gagan Surjit Dhingra, one of the arrested accused, had arranged liquor and food for the partygoers. Police are investigating from where the liquor was brought by the accused.

"A group of college friends had planned a party in Daman while hanging out at a cafe. Since very few agreed to go to Daman, they asked Dhingra to make arrangements for the party in the city," said a police officer. Dhingra is into designing marketing material and also arranges parties for people known to him.

Title: Kolkata: 60ft in 3 seconds, inadequate time at crossings puts pedestrians at risk
Content: KOLKATA: In a city where pedestrians comprise more than 55% fatalities in road accidents in a year, TOI has found several intersections where the time allotted to a pedestrian to cross an interaction is not enough for even a fit individual. While the pedestrian timer near the Kalighat Metro crossing allows pedestrians less than 6 seconds to cross a 80ft-wide road, the timer at the Jadavpur police station crossing allows a person just 3 seconds to cross the 60ft-wide street. In most cases, pedestrians only manage to go half way before the signal turns green for vehicles. TOI visited four key crossings and found how no one cares for pedestrians and how pedestrians themselves disobey rules.At Deshapran Sashmal Road-Netaji Subhas Road crossing in Tollygunge, the traffic light for pedestrians turns green every 90 seconds, but for only 5 seconds, leaving pedestrians, autos and rickshaws jostling to cross the road at the same time. “How are we expected to cross in 5 seconds in this traffic? I can barely reach the middle of the road by the time the pedestrian signal turns red and vehicles start moving,” said Kudghat resident Dhritiman Ganguly.The situation is worse at the Rashbehari Avenue-DPS Road crossing where pedestrians get 10 seconds to cross a 80ft-wide road every two minutes. To make things worse, the green light doesn’t work on at least one of the eight posts and the timer doesn’t work on at least three others. TOI found pedestrians running across the road even when vehicles began moving from multiple ends, making it a risky sprint.The situation is similar at the Rashbehari Avenue-Shyamaprasad Mukherjee Road crossing where the timers allow a pedestrian only 5 seconds to cross the road. However, all the timers and lights were functional here.The situation seemed worst at the Jadavpur police station intersection. At least one pedestrian signal was defunct and those crossing the road were given an impossible target of covering a 60ft stretch in three seconds. “I don’t want to violate the rules, but even before I could reach the median divider, the pedestrian signal turned red and vehicles began moving. For the rest of the road, I crossed like another jaywalker, raising my hand before approaching vehicles,” said Dhakuria resident Susmita Pal.“We conduct timely review exercises and if any changes or repairs are required, we take necessary action. But, at the same time, pedestrians need to be aware of the rules and should not give the excuse of too little time to cross or faulty timers if caught jaywalking,” said an officer.The cops had cut down the number of road accidents in 2019 to 267 from the 2018 figure of 294. However, in 2019, there were 151 pedestrian deaths against the 2018 figure of 146.“Ideally, to cross a road with two lanes in each flank, a pedestrian should be allowed a minimum of 12-14 seconds. Here the transport planning is carried out with only motorists in mind and pedestrians are ignored,” said Ajay Das, former chief traffic and transport-ation engineer of the transport department.

Title: After Nitish Kumar, Chirag Paswan to blow LJP’s poll bugle on April 14
Content:
Chirag Paswan

PATNA: After the state level workers’ meet of JD(U) on Sunday, LJP chief Chirag Paswan will be the next big political figure in Bihar to address his party workers and supporters at Gandhi Maidan in Patna on April 14 to mark the conclusion of his ongoing “Bihar First, Bihari First” Yatra. Chirag is apparently one of the most watched out leaders in the NDA in Bihar as he has been critical of allies BJP as well as JD(U).

Chirag had said at Sheikhpura on Saturday that though development has taken place in Bihar under CM Nitish Kumar, but more work is required to be done in several fields.

Talking to reporters at Sheikhpura, Chirag said: “Why Biharis migrate in highest number to other states. How will the issue of unemployment be resolved ... Nevertheless, talking about shortcomings of the government does not mean that there are fissures in the alliance government,” he clarified.

Earlier last week, he had said in Nalanda that BJP should take action against its leaders like Kapil Mishra and Giriraj Singh for making provocative statements, which were also among the reasons behind the loss of NDA in recently concluded Delhi elections.

Speaking at a public meeting at Jamui on Sunday, Chirag, who is the MP from the same constituency, said he would raise the issue of developing Lachhuar Jain Temple in the district on the lines of other big shrines like Badrinath Temple.

“This is the birth place of Bhagwan Mahavir. I have requested the state government several times to develop Lachhuar Jain Temple on the lines of several other big temples. Development of Lachhuar Temple would not only enhance the economic activities, it will also provide employment opportunities to youths from across the region,” Chirag said.

Apart from raising local issues, Chirag has also supported the demands of niyojit (contractual) teachers, who are on strike at present. The LJP chief claimed that he will include the demands of contractual teachers, including ‘equal pay for equal work’, in the vision document of his party. State government, on the other hand, has been taking strict action against the agitating teachers, including lodging FIRs and suspending them for dereliction of duty.

Chirag apart, his cousin and Samastipur MP Prince Raj has also been criss-crossing the hinterlands of the state under Bihar First , Bihari First Yatra of the party. He interacted with party workers in Paliganj assembly segment in Patna district on Sunday and asked them to spread awareness about the party’s campaign.

LJP sources said Bihar First, Bihari First Yatra, which was launched on February 21, is aimed at linking Bihar with the wheel of development by interacting with people and taking their feedback for framing a vision document. Chirag has said that LJP will release the manifesto of the party six months before the assembly elections in Bihar slated to be held in October-November, this year.

Title: JD(U) workers’ meet a flop show: Opposition
Content:
Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: Opposition parties in Bihar called the JD(U) workers’ meet on Sunday a flop show.

Leader of opposition in the state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav shared few photographs of the meet on his Twitter handle and sarcastically tweeted: “Congratulation for the success of great rally-cum-street show-cum-workers’ meet at Gandhi Maidan on the auspicious occasion of chief minister Nitish Kumar’s birthday. Those who are claiming to win 200 seats, could not even manage 50 people from each Vidhan Sabha constituency, in spite of using political, financial and muscle power and vulgar dance and song.”

Later, Tejashwi told reporters at Motihari : “JD(U) had actually organized a rally, but intentionally named it workers’ meet as they were never confident of pulling in people. Has anyone heard of workers’ meet at Gandhi Maidan? They could not even fill 20% of Gandhi Maidan and it was a flop show.”

Congress’s state spokesperson Rajesh Rathore said not even 15,000 people came to listen to a CM who is in power for the past 15 years. “In fact, only officials of the district administration and cops deputed on the venue were seen standing by the time Nitish was concluding his 100-minute speech,” he said.

RLSP national secretary general Madhaw Anand said JD(U) meet was to create pressure on its alliance partners before seat- sharing. “However, it was a flop how and people are not getting trapped by CM Nitish’s false claims,” he said.

HAM (S) spokesperson Danish Rizwan also gave a similar view and said: “I would advise CM Nitish to organize such meetings only at his party office, rather than making fun of Gandhi Maidan, where many big rallies and important political events have been organized in the past.”

Title: Lodhas to raise funds to repay $320 million bonds
Content:
(Representative image)

MUMBAI: Lodha Developers International — a subsidiary of Macrotech Developers (formerly Lodha) — had proposed to float an international bond issue of around $200 million to repay the company’s $324-million bonds maturing on March 13, 2020. However, rating agency Moody’s has said the company can issue the bonds only after it deposits $118 million in an escrow account for repayment of its maturing bonds.

The fund-raising in the coming weeks is crucial for the developer. Moody’s has said its negative outlook reflects the market risk and uncertainty around Macrotech Developers’ near-term refinancing plans and a persistent level of refinancing risk over 12 months. The rating agency said that if the upcoming bond is refinanced, it could revise the rating to stable. However, if the company fails to repay the $324 million on time, it could get downgraded.

The company already has access to a $112-million inventory facility, secured against unsold apartments at Lincoln Square, one of Macrotech Developers’ London projects. However, around $78 million will be used to repay an existing construction loan at the project, leaving just $34 million for deposit into the escrow account.

“Any delays in receiving such proceeds will result in a shortfall in the escrow account and prevent the bond transaction from progressing, increasing the likelihood of default. Macrotech Developers does not have alternate financing arrangements in place to repay the maturing bond,” said Moody’s analyst Sweta Patodia.

According to the rating agency, even if the company is able to fulfil the conditions required to proceed with the transaction, the bond execution — of at least $225 million — remains subject to market conditions. In addition, there are more repayments coming up.

Macrotech Developers has a $672-million construction loan outstanding at Grosvenor Square — its second London project — which is due for repayment in March 2021. The company also has about $323-million debt maturing in its India operations over 12 months.

Title: Nagpur: Audio clip helps cop file extortion complaint against man
Content:
Representative image

NAGPUR: An audio clip of a man demanding Rs15 lakh from a property dealer has helped cop filed an extortion complaint against him who had earlier filed a case of fraud against the dealer.

The accused has been identified as Gagan Chaurasiya, a resident of Sitabuldi.

According to police, Dhanraj Fuse, a property dealer, had a layout in Beltarodi and was selling residential plots. In August 2019, Fuse sold a plot to Gagan from his layout. However, after few days Gagan asked Fuse to give him another corner plot instead of the first one. Fuse transferred the corner plot in Gagan’s name.

After a few days, Fuse built his house on some of the plots in the layout, including the one he had earlier sold to Gagan.

Cops said, after Gagan learnt that Fuse had built the house on his earlier plot, he started demanding Rs15 lakh to sign a deed of transfer for the first plot. But when Fuse denied paying money to Gagan claiming that he had not paid for the second plot and it was given in exchange, the accused approached Beltarodi police station where a case of fraud was filed against Fuse.

Later, Fuse recorded an audio clip in which Gagan allegedly demanded Rs15 lakh from Fuse to sign the transfer deed of the first plot.

Fuse later approached Beltarodi police station with the clip. Officials, including senior PI VP Akot, took cognisance in the case and filed a case of extortion against Gagan.

“When the case of fraud was registered against Fuse he had not provided the audio clip. After we heard the audio clip, we registered the extortion case against Gagan. We have not made any arrests in both cases yet as the audio clip needs to be verified,” claimed PI Akot.

Title: Peace message: Citizens recount shared riot history on Facebook
Content: KOLKATA: In the wake of the violence in Delhi, social media has been flooded with anecdotes about communal harmony during the riots of 1946, 1965 and 1992 to spread the message of peaceful coexistence. Several Facebook users recalled how, during the Calcutta riots in 1946, tram workers — Dorbee, Rezzak and Ishak — saved students of Victoria Girls’ College from a mob and sent them home with the help of police. Similar episodes of resistance and courage by tram workers to save a Muslim slum in Belgachhia and clear the tracks of bodies to restore normalcy in the city were also shared.Agnidipto Tarafder, assistant professor at NUJS, Kolkata, shared a story he heard from his grandmother about her father, a doctor. “Dadai’s (Sailendranath Dutta) chamber was on Free School Street and the majority of his patients were Muslims, Christians and Dalits. One day during the riots, a Muslim man entered Dadai’s home in Taltala, creating panic in the house. But Dadai recognized him as a patient. He had come to request Dadai to visit his home near Free School Street as his wife was very ill. Against objections from the family, Dadai visited the man’s home and treated his wife. They said they would guard Dadai with their lives. Dadai returned home safe and he, in turn, escorted them safely out of the Hindu neighbourhood.”Film-maker and activist Kasturi Basu shared stories of two women revolutionaries and the Calcutta riots of 1965 on Facebook. The first story was about Bina Das, who single-handedly prevented a “programme of action” by a group of boys in the government housing estate near Prince Anwar Shah Road. The boys planned to burn Muslim bustees in “celebration”. When they reached Das’s house, she drove them back into their houses and spent the night on guard with a stick.The second story was about the fearless Ila Mitra, who was an MLA from Maniktala. She stood facing a riotous mob, stick in hand, yelling “Stop!” in a Muslim neighbourhood in Park Circus during the riots.“I heard the first story from my friend’s father and the second was told by Mitra’s son Mohon in an interview,” said Basu, adding, “These are stories that need to be re-told.”Associate professor of history in JU Maroona Murmu posted about an incident where Muslim neighbours protected Hindus in the Beckbagan-Park Circus area at the cost of their own lives in 1992, when violence escalated after the Babri Masjid demotion. According to Murmu, “In these times of fear and suspicion, it is important to spread the message of communal harmony and love.”

Title: Kolkata Accident: Woman killed as vehicle rams bike in Kolkata
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: A 38-year-old homemaker riding pillion was killed after the bike was hit by an unidentified vehicle on Kidderpore flyover on Saturday night. Police said Sapu Rabidas, a resident of Karl Marx Sarani in Kidderpore, was taken to SSKM Hospital while severely bleeding from the head where she was declared dead on arrival. Cops are yet to track down the vehicle that hit the bike but have levelled the stringent IPC section of 304 (culpable homicide not amounting to murder), apart from sections dealing with rash and negligent driving, against the driver.

On Saturday evening, a 64-year-old man from Laxmi Narayan Colony in Garia somehow lost control of the car he was driving and rammed the median divider on EM Bypass near Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute. Police said car owner Swapan Chowdhury, who was at the wheel, lost control of the car after another vehicle overtook him. Chowdhury suffered injuries on his chest, head, hands and knees and was taken to a private hospital off EM Bypass. He was discharged after preliminary treatment.

During the day on Saturday, two cases of rash and negligent driving were brought against two auto drivers. At Metiabruz, Md Nasim was booked for driving dangerously and without a licence while another auto driver was arrested from College Street for allegedly hitting a 33-year-old motorcyclist in front of IISWBM.

Title: Rajkot: Posing as cops, four robbers loot Rs 2.5 lakh from restaurant
Content:
Representative image

RAJKOT: Four unidentified robbers posing as cops committed the loot of Rs 2.50 lakh cash from a highway restaurant on the outskirts of Vandhia village near Samakhiyali in Kutch district on Saturday night.

Police said the robbers arrived in a black car. Identifying themselves as cops, the robbers accused three staffers of the restaurant of selling liquor and beat them up.

“Then the accused started checking the restaurant during which they found Rs 2.50 lakh cash from the bag belonging to Manindarsingh Jat, nephew of the restaurant owner, Bodsingh Jat,” said R J Sisodia, sub-inspector with Samakhiyali police station.

The accused locked up the restaurant staffers — Vicky Sharma, Buta Bharwad and Baba Bharwad inside the cabin — before fleeing from the spot. Bodsingh was away to his native in Punjab when the crime was committed.

“As the CCTV camera of the restaurant was defunct at the time of the crime, we are checking the CCTV cameras of other restaurants along the way on which the robbers were supposed to have travelled,” added Sisodia.

Title: Kolkata: Businessman held for Kalighat accident
Content:
TimesView This accident shows how just one reckless and irresponsible driver can negate all the work that goes into making our streets safer for pedestrians. Cops have little to do in such cases. But they must ensure that incidents like Friday's do not disrupt their normal plans. Bringing the culprit to trial and ensuring proper punishment will also help.

KOLKATA: A 23-year-old businessman who ran over and killed a 44-year-old schoolteacher in Kalighat on Saturday, fled to Odish a after the accident and returned to the city on Sunday, was arrested from the Howrah station. Santosh Sahani, who has an electrical goods business in Kidderpore , was picked up by cops around 6am and was charged with rash and negligent driving and culpable homicide not amounting to murder. He was produced in a city court and remanded in police custody till March 4.Around 7am on Saturday, schoolteacher Subhalakshmi Banerjee was on her way to her SP Mukherjee Road home after buying flowers from the Kalighat temple area when the car allegedly driven by Sahani hit her. Witnesses said Banerjee was trying to cross the road when it was signalled red for vehicular movement and was hit by the SUV when she reached the middle. The impact was such that Banerjee was flung in the air and fell on the bonnet of the vehicle. In his attempt to flee and to shake her off, the driver took a sharp turn to the right and Banerjee fell off. The fleeing driver did not stop but reportedly ran her over as he sped away.The driver had allegedly even grazed a traffic official at the Rashbehari Avenue-Deshapran Sashmal Road crossing before speeding towards Kidderpore.According to cops, once he reached his home, the driver left the car at a garage, took a bike to Howrah station and boarded a train to Odisha. “We traced his address from the vehicle’s registration number caught in the CCTV camera. When we found he had fled, we traced his cellphone tower. We arrested him when he came back to the city on Sunday,” said an officer.Police said Sahani was with a group of friends and was returning from Dhakuria when the accident happened. He has told cops that he had fled in panic fearing he would be beaten up by locals.

Title: JD(U) meet: NDA sets ball rolling for Bihar assembly polls
Content:
Nitish Kumar (ANI)

PATNA: The JD(U) workers’ meet on Sunday set the tone and tenor of NDA campaign in the upcoming state assembly elections due in October-November this year.

While addressing the meet, CM Nitish Kumar, who is also the JD(U) national president, outlined the party’s strategy by comparing the 15 years of Lalu-Rabri “jungle raj” versus less than 15 years of his rule of law and good governance and, asked the party workers to counter the opposition (RJD) charge against his government on law & order and development fronts.

It seems the NDA comprising JD(U), BJP and LJP in Bihar will have three-pronged strategy to take on RJD-led opposition. As Nitish highlighted his government’s success on the issues of law & order, pace of development, status of primary and higher secondary education, health, infrastructure and schemes for the minority community in the last 15 years, deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi, in a tweet on Sunday, pooh-poohed RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav’s claim of bringing a domicile policy, if voted to power. LJP chief Chirag Paswan is on a statewide tour to prepare a vision document of his party for further development of the state under NDA rule.

Since his recent meetings with Tejashwi in the state assembly had sent confusing signal in the state that whether JD(U) is getting soft towards RJD again, Nitish used the opportunity to clear any doubt in the party’s rank and file by emphasizing that the NDA was intact in Bihar and it would win more than 200 seats in the 243-member Bihar assembly.

Speculations were rife regarding fresh possible political alignments after Nitish got the resolution adopted unanimously in the assembly against NRC and in favour of NPR only in its 2010 format, except including transgender column. RJD was pressing for a resolution against NPR and NRC and had brought adjournment motion in the assembly that day. Though the anti-NRC resolution had taken BJP by surprise as it was adopted in a swift move, barring a few of its leaders like agriculture minister Prem Kumar, it preferred to downplay the issue behind PM Narendra Modi’s statement that NRC had not been discussed yet and there was no need to create brouhaha over the issue.

The JD(U) had won the 2015 assembly election in alliance with Lalu Prasad’s RJD and Congress and formed the government before parting ways with them and joining hands with BJP in the state in July 2017.

Since the opposition RJD is raising the issue of unemployment in the state, Nitish did not miss the opportunity to mention the appointment of 3.5 lakh schoolteachers on contract to score a point while taking a dig at the Lalu-Rabri rule by asking how many appointments were made during that period.

Title: PM, Tejashwi greet Nitish on 69th birthday
Content:
PATNA: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and leaders from several political parties extended birthday wishes to CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday. “Greetings to Bihar’s Chief Minister and my friend Sri @Nitish Kumar Ji. A popular leader who has risen from grassroots, he’s been at the forefront of furthering Bihar’s development. His passion towards social empowerment is noteworthy. Praying for his long and healthy life,” read the PM’s tweet on the 69th birthday of Nitish.

RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s son Tejashwi Prasad Yadav also greeted Nitish, referring him as his guardian. “Birthday greetings to respected guardian Shri Nitish Kumar Ji. I pray to God that you move ahead with self-respect and dignity and be healthy and have long life. Your cooperation is expected in our fight to get special status for Bihar and to do away with unemployment,” Tejashwi tweeted.

Home Minister Amit Shah greeted Nitish on his birthday and wished him to continue to work relentlessly for the welfare and development of Bihar.

LJP patron Ram Vilas Paswan shared his photo with Nitish on his Twitter and referred him as an energetic chief minister. “Under your able leadership, Bihar has achieved a new development parameter and I am sure it will continue to do so,” read his tweet.

BJP national president JP Nadda, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar, BJP MP Rajiv Pratap Rudy and state road construction department minister Nand Kishore Yadav wished Nitish through social media.

Title: Cleaner in police station printed, supplied fake notes; caught
Content:
Surat: A team of Surat range IGP office arrested two persons from Kosamba in Surat district on Sunday for allegedly dealing in counterfeit currency notes. Police recovered fake notes of Rs 25,45,000 face value from the accused in Rs 500 and Rs 2,000 denomination.

Police arrested Naran Solanki, 58, a resident of Kosamba and Prashant alias Raju Patel, 47, a resident of Borbhatha village in Surat, for allegedly printing and dealing in counterfeit currency notes. One accused Shashikant Bhavshankar, a resident of Jahangripura area in city, is yet to get arrested.

Shashikant used to print the fake notes on a computer printer while the other two accused searched for buyers and delivered these notes to them, police said.

Accused Solanki works as a cleaner at Kosamba police station and had allegedly assured his accomplices that he will take care if police takes actions against them, sources in police informed.

Police laid a reverse trap on receiving specific information about Solanki's involvement in the racket. The dummy caller contacted Solanki over phone and inquired for fake notes. Solanki agreed to provide fake notes of face value of Rs 25 lakh and demanded half of it in real currency as charges. After they agreed on a price, Patel came to deliver the notes in Kosamba where he was caught with the fake notes. Police later nabbed Solanki too.

"Police are investigating that how many counterfeit currency has already been pumped in the market by the accused. Police will also find out from where the main accused learned printing of fake notes," said a police officer.

Title: Day after fire, Mohali building declared unsafe
Content:
Mohali: The building housing Vishal Mega Mart in Phase V was declared dangerous and unsafe on Sunday, a day after it was engulfed in fire.

To be on the safer side, the local administration filled 3-ft water in the basement of the building to ensure that the embers were doused. Firefighters were not allowed to enter the building as it was feared that it may collapse following cracks in the walls.

Officiating deputy commissioner-cum-additional deputy commissioner Ashika Jain said, “We will be conducting an inquiry into the incident. The report will be submitted to the chief minster office. Secondly, we will also secure technical advice from experts on the structural stability of the building to decide whether it should be demolished or not.”

The fire had broken out in the early hours of Saturday. It took more than 30 fire tenders, which made over 100 rounds, to bring the blaze under control in an operation that continued until Sunday, Jain said. “The firemen are still stationed outside the building to ensure that if any fire re-occurs, it can act on time. The building has been sealed,” Jain said.

The building was cordoned off as its structural safety was yet to be ascertained. Duty magistrates were appointed at the site round the clock.

Jain said fire safety rules should be followed by all to prevent such incidents. She said regular inspections will be conducted and legal action initiated against the non-compliant units.

Had the fire broken out during the morning or evening hours, lives could have been lost. An official said, “As the fire occurred at 8.30 am, there was no public in the shopping mall, otherwise it could have been a major tragedy. We have submitted our preliminary report to administration pointing out the discrepancies. We had already issued a notice earlier to the shopping mall for violation of fire norms.” He said he has reported to the administration that the building where hundreds of people came daily violated all fire safety norms. The basement had a single entry and exit point.

Title: Droom eyes $150m round before IPO
Content:
Chennai: Online auto marketplace Droom is hitting the street for a $150-million pre-IPO fund-raising round, its last one before an it goes for an IPO in 2021.

According to Droom CEO Sandeep Aggarwal, this will be the company’s sixth funding round, for which Credit Suisse and “two more advisers” have been mandated to find investors. Droom is planning an IPO listing in end-2021 and the funding will be wrapped up “in the next 4-5 months”, Aggarwal said.

Currently valued at just under $1 billion, Droom has so far raised around $125 million from investors including Lightbox, Singapore-based global fund Beenext, Japanese firm Beenos, Tokyo-based VC firm Digital Garage, Toyota Tsusho Corporation, and Hong Kong based multi-billion family office Integrated Assets Management. “Many of our current investors will participate but a new one will lead the round,” said Aggarwal. Earlier, several investors in the company had participated in multiple rounds.

Title: PhD viva on Skype now syndics’ call
Content:
Chandigarh: Panjab University plans to introduce PhD viva-voce through free video-calling application Skype for ease. Dean of research R K Singla pitched it to the vice-chancellor’s committee on MPhil/PhD rules and the members liked the idea. On March 8, the committee’s detailed report will be tabled in a syndicate meeting for final approval. Dean Singla had proposed that Skype interviews will save the time and expenditure of the university, the candidates, and the examiners. Besides, the academic world has become technology-driven.

The committee discussed the case of a research scholar, who wanted the mathematics department to waive her fee after the cancellation of PhD. Members were of view that candidates who failed to complete their research degrees due to pressing circumstances shouldn’t face inconvenience because of harsh fines. They were in favour of fixing a minimum fine that was within the reach of all candidates, and seeking the syndicate’s approval. The committee proposed Rs 5,000 as cancellation fee for quitting the PhD programme, instead of charging candidates for every year.

Another committee recommendation was for lowering the qualifying score in MPhil/PhD entrance test paper I from 50% to 40%.

Title: 3D shows made free at Patna zoo
Content:
PATNA: The 3D shows at Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park, commonly known as Patna zoo , were made free for visitors on Sunday. More than 500 visitors enjoyed the free shows on the first day.

Earlier, the zoo used to charge Rs 30 from an adult and Rs 15 from a child for each show. The shows, however, were free for children below three years.

A zoo official said two 3D movies – ‘The Last Reef: Cities Beneath the Sea’ and ‘Conquest of the Skies’ – were screened on Sunday.

“The ‘Conquest of the Skies’ by David Attenborough is an evolutionary story on the extraordinary journey of the evolution of insects beginning with their flight from the very first insect to being the incredible collection of creatures which in today’s time rule the skies. The ‘The Last Reef: Cities Beneath the Sea’, on the other hand, talks about the world of water and its tiniest creatures and coral reefs,” the official added.

The interpretation-cum-3D theatre at the zoo was inaugurated in March last year by deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi. The theatre has a seating capacity of 150 people.

Patna zoo director Amit Kumar said the 3D movies will not just entertain people, but also educate them. “At least six shows of 45-minute duration each will be screened from 10am to 5pm for visitors every day,” he said.

“More than 15,000 people visited the zoo on Sunday. Of them, 532 people watched the shows. We want to give visitors a new-age dimension of learning through the movies screened at the zoo. People can see animals in their natural habitat through the movies,” he added.

Title: Nawada MLA gets a leg massage
Content:
PATNA: In a major embarrassment to the ruling JD(U), a video went viral on the social media on Sunday in which Nawada MLA Kaushal Yadav could be seen getting his legs massaged by party workers at the ‘Karyakarta Sammelan’ at Gandhi Maidan here.

In the video, Yadav can be seen lying on the ground at Gandhi Maidan and two party workers massaging his legs. One of the workers is seen preparing ‘khaini’ (chewing tobacco).

Yadav, however, said his leg was injured while he was entering the Maidan through a barricaded small gate. “I got minor injury in the leg. Some workers offered to do massage so that I get immediate relief. It was nothing unusual,” he said.

Yadav, a four-time MLA, is a popular leader of Nawada district. He won Nawada seat in a byelection in 2019. Earlier, he represented Gobindpur constituency in Nawada district thrice. Yadav’s wife Purnima was earlier three-time MLA from Nawada constituency. Now, she represents Gobindpur in the assembly from Congress.

Title: City residents rue traffic restrictions on Sundays
Content:
PATNA: Commuters had to face the brunt of traffic restriction due to JD(U)’s state level workers’ meet held at Gandhi Maidan on Sunday.

No private vehicles, except emergency vehicles, were allowed on roads, leading to Gandhi Maidan from 6am. Also, barricading on Fraser Road, SP Verma Road, Bans Ghat and eastern part of Ashok Rajpath and Bari Path led to congestion on the link roads.

Those unaware about the restrictions had either to take longer routes or keep trying alternate route to reach their destinations.

This was the second consecutive Sunday spoiler for Patnaites, as similar obstruction in vehicular movement was witnessed on February 23 owing to Bhim Army-led Bharat bandh in protest against the Supreme Court ruling that states were not bound to provide reservation in government jobs or quota in promotion.

Residents are unhappy with such restrictions on every Sunday. Dipak Kumar has been cancelling plans for the last two Sundays to take his kids to zoo.

Mahwish Fatima, 24, had to call off her pre-planned birthday party on Sunday. She had arranged for a get-together with her friends at a restaurant on Boring Road.

Sabzibagh resident Shahnawaz, whose sister’s wedding was scheduled on Sunday in a hall near Bank Road, transported all edible raw material to the venue a day before. “We requested the manager of the hall to give us one room at least in advance, so that we could store all edibles on Saturday night. We did not want to take any risk as the stretch of road leading to hall passed by Gandhi Maidan,” he said.

Even shopkeepers rued poor sales this Sunday. “Though Holi is nearby, we could not get expected number of customers as people preferred to stay at home, than getting stuck on roads,” said Chotu, who works in a shoe shop on Boring Road.

Title: VNSGU lands in major controversy over MoU with private institute
Content:
Surat: Top authorities of Veer Narmad South Gujarat University (VNSGU) landed in a major controversy after majority of syndicate members cancelled an MoU that the university had entered into with a private sports management institute, recently. The syndicate members cornered vice-chancellor Shivendra Gupta in the specially called syndicate meeting here on Sunday.

Gupta was forced to cancel the MoU with NEST Academy of Sports Management and Development, NASM Educare LLP. He refused to do and asked the syndicate to cancel it instead. The syndicate members demanded setting up of an inquiry committee to find out how the MoU was cleared with a private organization which would have collected Rs6 lakh from students as fees. The MoU was ultimately cancelled.

"The firm was introduced to the university by the vice-chancellor and his supporters. Later, they speeded up the process and the sports management courses were cleared by the authorized body,” a syndicate member said.

Meanwhile, Gupta alleged, "All the syndicate members were aware about the process. They had approved it in the initial stage and after their approval, a committee was formed that looked into details of the MoU and courses. Everything was done in a transparent manner.”

Title: Bodies of two boys exhumed on murder suspicion
Content:
Rajkot: The bodies of two children who had drowned in a well around three months ago were exhumed from their graves in Rampar Goriyali village of Ghogha taluka in Bhavnagar district on Sunday. The father of one the deceased child told the police that the bodies were extricated to confirm his suspicion that the children had been murdered.

The police had suspected that the two cousins, both five years of age, identified as Vivek Jambucha and Pradeep Jambucha, had fallen into the well accidentally and had registered an accidental death case.

However on Friday, father of Vivek, Ashwin Jambucha approached the police with an application of complaint, alleging that his uncle Lakshman Jambucha and his wife Kamu Jambucha had killed the sons of his and his brother, following a property dispute.

“We exhumed the bodies of the children in the presence of the mamlatdar and sent them to Sir T Hospital in Bhavnagar for forensic postmortem. The further course of action will be decided after the postmortem report is released,” said P R Solanki, sub-inspector with Ghogha police station.

Two and a half months ago, both Vivek and Pradeep had left their home, telling their family members that they were going to a shop to buy chocolates. However, they never returned and went missing. A few days later, their bodies were found floating in the well.

Title: RJD will bring domicile policy in Bihar: Tejashwi Yadav
Content:
Tejashwi Yadav

MOTIHARI: Leader of opposition Tejaswi Prasad Yadav said on Sunday that if voted to power in the upcoming assembly elections, his party (RJD) will bring a domicile policy and reserve 90% of government jobs for natives of the state.

“Around 7 crore educated youths are running from pillar to post to get a job in the state for the last 15 years. I would urge people to exercise their franchise in the upcoming election keeping in mind these issues and remove Nitish Kumar government, who is only busy in saving his chair,” Tejashwi said in a public meet at Zila School Maidan here under his ‘Berojgari Hatao Yatra’.

He said CAA and NRC are ‘kala kanoon’ (black laws) and anti-poor and asked people to fight against these laws. “The NDA government is trying to divide the society but RJD chief Lalu Prasad is still alive and we, the party workers, stand behind minorities, Dalit and OBCs to protect their constitutional rights,” Tejashwi said and stressed on the need to maintain communal harmony at any cost.

“The problems in our state are unemployment, poverty, poor health facilities, bad education policy and corruption in government offices. But the NDA government only talks about Pakistan. The corrupt government officers are indulged in bribery and they don’t care even about peoples’ representatives,” he said and added: “Common people have no way out to get their work done in government offices without giving bribe. The NDA government has promised to double the income of farmers but they are selling their grains in open market at lower prices.”

Tejashwi said Nitish government has no vision or road map for all-round development of Bihar. “Nitish has failed to fulfil the aspirations of common man in the last 15 years. A strong will power is needed to make modern Bihar and solve the problem of unemployment. We, the RJD men, have strong will to address all such issues plaguing the state,” he said.

Talking about the long awaited beautification of historic Moti Jheel in Motihari town, Tejashwi said that funds to the tune of several crores have been swindled in the name of its beautification but even encroachments have not been removed in the last 15 years.

Tejashwi claimed that if voted to power, he will get reopened all closed sugar mills in Champaran, in which hundreds of people will get employment.

Title: Once smitten twice bold: Surat’s runaway in-laws run away again
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: After their ‘love at second sight’, the infamous runaway in-laws from Surat have eloped for a second time!

The lovebirds – 45-year-old textile businessman and his son's former mother-in-law – were brought back home the first time after spending 17 days together in January. Having spent a lonely Valentine’s, the duo decided to elope again, and on Saturday both disappeared from their respective homes.

Incidentally, the duo’s children called off their own marriage in the heat of their parents’ affair. Sources close to the development informed that the businessman's in-laws had recently held multiple meetings with him at his residence in an attempt to convince him to forget the ‘other’ woman.

“The family must have come to know that he is still in touch with the woman after which they started counselling him," the source added.

However, while that was going on, the man failed to return home in Chhaprabhatha area on Saturday night after which the family members started searching for him. "They had a doubt that he may have gone to meet the woman and so, got their doubts checked through a common source. They found out that the woman also did not return home," said a community leader.

The community leaders were alerted by relatives of both the individuals after the duo disappeared again. "The businessman's family told us that they do not wish to search for him. Similarly, the woman's parents too have refused to search for her," the community leader added.

After the couple returned home the first time, the woman was not allowed by her husband, a diamond broker, to enter his house despite several efforts and so she had to shift to her parental home.

The couple is now suspected to be hiding in Varachha area and has hired a house on rent. "Though they did not share exact location, the businessman called up his friend on Saturday night asking for monetary support," said a person, who is in touch with the man’s family.

Talking to TOI after his return on February 8, the businessman had claimed, "I will take responsibility of her (the woman) if she is not accepted by her husband." He, however, denied having any contact with her then.

Terming her elopement as a mistake, the woman too on February 10 told TOI, "I am not in touch with him any more and I wish to go back to my husband. I don’t want to keep any relation with him."

After they disappeared on January 10, the duo went to Ujjain . They were traced in Indore on January 27 and brought back to the city by family members. The businessman and the woman knew each other since their school days in Katargam . Her father, however, had rejected the man’s proposal to marry the woman. Later they met in the recent past when her son and his daughter were engaged to be married.



In Video: Infamous runaway in-laws from Surat elope for a second time!

Title: Most auto drivers do not run fare meters in Kochi
Content: KOCHI: Despite several crackdowns by motor vehicles department (MVD) and the traffic police, auto drivers in the city have been fleecing passengers. Most of them refuse to run by meters or have faulty meters.A reality check by TOI revealed that many auto drivers in the city switch on the meters only when prompted. They also charge a minimum Rs 30 against the fixed fare of Rs 25 for a distance of 1.5km.The driver of the auto hired by this reporter on Sunday morning switched on the meter reluctantly after he was asked to do so. After a trip from Kacheripady Junction to Deshabhimani Junction, he demanded a fare of Rs 50 against the Rs 32 on meter. When questions were raised on overcharging, the driver stated that he would not get a passenger during return trip.But another driver charged only the minimum amount from Kacheripady to Padma Junction on the same day. A passenger who spoke to TOI, said he was asked to pay Rs 90 for a 3.7km trip from Kaloor to MG Road recently. When he argued, the driver refused to budge and insisted on the fare.Santha, a senior citizen who wanted to hire an auto from Convent Junction to Broadway, said the driver asked her to cough up excess fare for the trip that was well below minimum distance. “The driver insisted that I should pay him Rs 50 for a distance of less than 500m. When I questioned him, he told me to hire another vehicle. I was forced to walk along the traffic-choked road until I got another auto, which charged me only Rs 20,” she said, adding that there are auto drivers who behave decently with passengers and charge only the exact amount.The high court had issued an order in February this year directing the government to display printed fare cards but it has not yet been implemented. Drivers are booked under Section 19 (1) F of MVD Act for misbehaviour and overcharging, when complaints are raised against them.Singer Reshmi Satheesh, who was harassed by an auto driver after she argued with him over excess fare, shifted to a two-wheeler following the incident. “I rarely travel in autos now. But I will not say that all auto drivers are overcharging and misbehaving with passengers. There are many drivers who behave decently,” she said.

Title: Speed governor must for Patna school buses
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Errant school bus drivers will now be penalized under the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act, as per the latest guidelines issued by the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR), Bihar State Commission for Protection of Child Rights (BSCPCR) and Bihar Education Project Council (BEPC).

According to a senior functionary of BSCPCR: “School buses should have speed governors to check overspeed, which is not only dangerous for the children but for other motorists and pedestrians on the road as well. Speed governor will keep a check on overspeed.”

He added: “School Bus must be written on the front and back of the buses and should display ‘On School Duty’. The name of the school along with contact details should also be displayed on the bus.”

Besides, school buses should have horizontal grill-fitted windows with mesh wires and doors should be fitted with locks in order to reduce the safety risks of schoolchildren.

A slew of other measures, including provision for a first-aid box and fire extinguisher, are required to ensure safety of schoolchildren in buses. As per the guidelines, every school bus should have closed doors with a lock system. Alarms should also be fitted on the doors in order to give warning to the drivers in case they are left open.

School authorities have been directed to inspect the school buses on a regular basis. “The authorities should appoint only those drivers, who have five years of experience in driving a school bus. Closed-circuit television (CCTV) cameras should also be installed for ensuring the safety of students. Also, three adults, including a trained driver, conductor and lady attendant should always be present on the school bus,” the guidelines stated.

Title: Jail inmate gets rousing farewell at Patna hospital
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Notorious criminal Bindu Singh received a rousing farewell in police presence while being taken back to Beur jail from AIIMS-Patna after his treatment on Friday. A video of his supporters garlanding their godfather went viral on Saturday, leaving the police red-faced. Bindu’s supporters, mostly youths, could be heard terming him even ‘Bihar Kesari’.

Prison sources said Bindu is lodged in Beur jail in several cases of serious nature. “Looking at his criminal background, he has been kept in a ward where only one criminal is accommodated. He is suffering from prostate cancer and frequently requires to visit hospital for chemotherapy,” a senior prison officer said, preferring anonymity.

When asked if he had come to know about the viral video, the officer confirmed the incident but said taking him to hospital and bringing him back to jail is district police’s responsibility .

“Prison’s department responsibility ends at jail gate. A prisoner’s security at hospital during treatment is also the responsibility of district police concerned,” he said.

Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma told TOI over phone that such activities are not allowed as the prisoner was in judicial custody. “I will, however, look into the matter,” he said.

Title: ‘Efforts needed for character building’
Content:
The governor said transmission of book knowledge was not the final aim of education.

GAYA: Governor-cum-chancellor Phagu Chauhan on Sunday exhorted the teachers and students of Magadh University to realize PM Narendra Modi’s ‘Ek Bharat, Shreshta Bharat’ vision. He was speaking at the function held in MU auditorium on the 59th foundation day of the university.

The foundation for the university’s establishment was laid by the then Vice-President Sarwapalli Radhakrishnan on March 1,1962. Later the same year, Radhakrishnan took over as the country’s second President.

The governor said transmission of book knowledge was not the final aim of education. “Character building of the students was no less important, for which a concerted effort was needed. Peace and harmony were sine qua non for the country’s development and it is our national duty to make India develop and prosper,” he said.

Dwelling on the challenges facing higher education in the state, the governor said full implementation of the academic calendar, including timely admission, transparent registration, sincere classroom practices, fair exams and evaluation and result publication were the important ingredients of academic calendar.

The governor hoped that the universities in the state will ensure that distinct improvement is recorded in state’s higher education system to make it compare favourably with the other national and international institutions.

In his welcome speech, Magadh University VC Prof Rajendra Prasad regretted the shortage of teachers. He said despite recent recruitments, the shortage of teachers persists and there was need for appointment of guest teachers.

The VC informed the governor that vocational education in 45 different subjects was being imparted in the university under the self-finance mode. He also said PG diploma courses in defence management and disaster management would be introduced in the university. It has been his endeavour to cultivate a science based value system in the university and give shape to innovation in the field of education. He also said that the academic sessions would fully be regularized in the next few months.

The VC said the proposed exchange programmes with educational institutions of China has hit a roadblock on account of spread of coronavirus.

Speaking on the occasion, MU alumni and state agriculture minister Prem Kumar said resource crunch would not be allowed to come in the way of the university’s development programmes.

Other dignitaries present on the occasion included additional chief secretary-cum-secretary to the governor Brajesh Mehrotra and MU syndicate member Anil Swami. Registrar professor S P Deen proposed the vote of thanks.

Title: Chandauli boat capsize: NDRF finds teen’s body, four missing
Content:
Rescue operation in Saiyyedraja area of Chandauli district

Varanasi: The body of a 15-year-old girl, who was riding the ill-fated boat that capsized in the Ganga in Chandauli district on Saturday evening, was fished out by NDRF divers on Sunday after a 12-hour marathon search.

Four others — Phulwasi (56), Urmila (30), Kavita (15) and Moti (10) — are still missing and feared drowned, Chandauli SP Hemant Kutiyal said. He said search would continue into the night and till the others were found.

The government has announced a compensation of Rs 4 lakh to families of those who have lost their lives.

The boat, ferrying 40 farm labourers and their family members from Dhina to Mauji village, had begun taking in water after it reached Saiyyedraja area and had snapped into two midstream. Kutiyal said 35 people either managed to swim to safety or were rescued in time. “But, the rest are feared drowned. The NDRF unit from Varanasi was called to help in the search,” he added.

Title: Eflu admissions rise by 265% this year
Content: Hyderabad: The number of applicants at the English and Foreign Languages University (Eflu) has increased by 265% since 2016-17. The leap in numbers was seen across various programmes. The total applications received by Eflu for 2020-2021 is 15,168. TNN

Title: Chandigarh: Gardener’s daughter bags wushu gold in Russia
Content:
Anju Kumari, the medal winner, with her coaches

CHANDIGARH: Anju Kumari, a student of Government Model Senior School, Sector 26, has bagged a gold medal in the recently-concluded Moscow Wushu Star 2020 held in the Russian capital from February 24 to 29, bringing laurels to the city.

The annual tournament is duly recognized by the International Wushu Federation and the European Wushu Federation. Around 700 athletes from 19 countries participated in the tournament.

Born to a gardener father Bal Krishan deputed at Butterfly Park, Sector 26, Anju got her initial training on self-defence from Swayam Team of Chandigarh Police before being spotted by the Wushu Association of Chandigarh .

The 17-year-old, one of five siblings, started her training under the Wushu Association of Chandigarh a couple of years ago and immediately proved her mettle by winning a gold medal at the 18th Junior National Wushu Championship held in the city in September 2019.

Coached by Sandeep Malik and coaches Manoj and Ram Mehar during the national camps, the youngster’s expenses were borne by the Wushu Association of Chandigarh.

Elated at her achievement, Sudershan Kumar, general secretary, Wushu Association of Chandigarh, termed it as a “prized moment for the city’’.

“She has been training with us for the past two years and from the first day, she was a special talent for us. We had no hesitation in bearing all her expenses, including the routine medical fees. We are also grateful to the Sports Authority of India and the sports ministry for their support,” Kumar told TOI.

“We congratulate Anju and her coaches on her success. It is a proud moment for us at the association, which runs without any financial and infrastructural support from the UT administration. I hope her medal will bring in a positive change for the other athletes in the city,” he added.

Anju’s family is delighted at their daughter’s feat. Krishan told TOI, “We did not know about the sport initially, but we let her learn self-defence, as you know these days girls need to protect themselves. But then seeing her interests, we encouraged her to go for her training. This gold medal is a blessing from the wushu association and the coaches. I am thankful to them.”

Kumar further said Anju will get residential training at the recently-established SAI Wushu Centre of Excellence in Itanagar under the Khelo India Scheme. The Sports Authority of India will bear the cost of her education and training along with three more players from the city, Roshni, Komal and Gayatri.

The Indian team, comprising 29 players in the junior category returned with six gold, six silver and three bronze medals in various weight categories. Anju bagged the yellow metal in the junior (Sanshou) category under-52 kg.

Title: Kerala: Cochin airport runway re-carpeting works enter final stage
Content: KOCHI: The runway re-carpeting works at the Cochin International Airport Limited ( Cial ), which have partially affected flight operations for more than three months, have reached the final stage .About 95% works of the runway, estimated at Rs 151 crore, have been completed and the remaining works are related to upgrading the Airfield Ground Lighting (AGL). The re-carpeting of the taxiway too has been completed.Officials said the works that began on November 20 will be completed before March 28 deadline and that round-the-clock flight services will resume from March 29.“Re-carpeting of the runway was one of the most crucial works at the airport in the recent past. The previous re-carpeting was done in 2009 when Cial had less than 70 flights a day. Now, it has increased to 260 services catering to nearly 30,000 passengers a day. Though we had to shut down the operations during day time, only five services were cancelled as all the airlines got enough time to reschedule timings as they were intimated one-and-a-half year in advance,” said P S Jayan, corporate communications manager, Cial.As per the director general of civil aviation’s prescribed norms, all airports should re-carpet their runways once in 10 years. “Though the old runway was in perfect condition, we could not have delayed it any longer because, if the bitumen layer of the runway started developing cracks, it would be dangerous,” said an official.Along with the runway re-carpeting, the AGL (airfield ground lighting) system at the airport is also being upgraded to category III from category I. This include upgrading approach lighting systems, runway lights and taxiway lights, among other things. This will considerably improve operational efficiency and aerodrome safety, especially during adverse weather conditions. The upgrade work is estimated to cost Rs 35 crore.

Title: Pathrakulam land: Govt’s plans may not bear fruit
Content:
Thiruvananthapuram: After two consecutive failures to convince the court in the past three years, the state government made optimum use of an additional day in February to resume the land, where the Theerthapada Mandapam is situated ( Pathrakulam ). It was assigned to Shree Vidyadhiraja Sabha four decades ago.

The hasty takeover and a string of loopholes in Saturday night’s order has now opened channels for another round of legal battle.

“We are moving high court. The forceful takeover has no legal validity,” said Ajay Kumar, secretary of Shree Vidyadhiraja Sabha.

Through its order, the revenue department has wiped off any illegality in filling up Pathrakulam after contending repeatedly in the past that it was unauthorised and had been responsible for blockage of drainage and consequent flooding.

However, the government clung on to the point of non-payment of amount for land assignment, a contention which the court had refused to accept in 2017 and 2019. It all waters down to a matter over payment of Rs 48,750 as land value which ought to have been paid by the society: First as 50% and then as two annual instalments by 1978.

In the hearing held in 2018, it was pointed out that the society owed Rs 24,375 as balance payment for the land to be assigned to them. Even considering simple interest, the society representatives say that it would come to less than Rs 2 lakh and in case of a cent percent penalty, it would still be less than Rs 4 lakh.

The issue, however, is the missing documents. In the latest order, the revenue department points out that the society failed to produce documents to prove payment of remaining 50% of land value.

The contention that they submitted original receipts with the application for title deed cannot be accepted since such an application could not be found at village/taluk or collectorate level. Revenue principal secretary V Venu said the cardinal point based on which the government resumed the land is that the society failed to make the required payment.

“The burden of proof is on them as they failed to furnish evidence of payment,” said Venu. He said it is the only point based on which the land was resumed. As regarding the matter pertaining to land being transferred by the society to a trust, he said it was just an observation and the resumption order was based only on arrears.

The society had filed an application under RTI Act in January 2020 at Vanchiyoor village office seeking scrutiny of registers of income between 1975-1980. The public information officer replied that the registers were destroyed and hence information regarding income received between 1975-1980 cannot be made available.

Kumar said the government’s continued insistence on non-payment of balance amount accounts to contempt of court. “On previous two occasions, such a reason was quashed by the court,” he said. He also referred to the RTI reply and said that the government itself cannot store its documents properly and now it asks for evidence from the society.

According to the Sabha, it made 50% payment in 1976 and the balance was paid in 1977 and 1978 at Vanchiyur village office. When asked why it failed to produce receipt of payment made in 1977, Kumar said: “The application for title deed was filed by submitting original receipts.”

Title: BHU docs threaten to stop emergency service at hosp
Content:
Doctors said BHU authorities have failed to allay security concerns

Varanasi: Continuing their strike for second consecutive day on Sunday against assault by an attendant and his associates on their colleague, resident doctors have threatened to paralyse emergency services from Tuesday if their demands for arrest of all the accused and enhancement of security are not met.

As outdoor patient department (OPD) of trauma centre remains closed on Sundays, no effect of the strike was evident there. However, agitating doctors tried to hamper work at indoor patient department where patients are kept in wards.

Professor in-charge of trauma centre, BHU , Dr Sanjeev Kumar Gupta said, “Despite the strike of junior residents, treatment of patients, emergency services and ICUs were not affected as consultants and senior residents were available to manage it.”

Junior resident doctors, who held a meeting on Sunday morning, decided to continue their strike and alleged that during talks with them university officials could not give any concrete assurance on increasing the number of security personnel.

They said the police failed to arrest two other accused who had thrashed their colleague.
