Jha who was travelling from Bawana to Ghaziabad was allegedly stopped by a group and beaten up with an iron rod. “The incident took place between 4 pm and 5pm. My brother works in the hardware sector and had gone to Bawana buy some material. When he was returning, some of the main roads leading towards Ghaziabad were barricaded. He was forced to take the internal roads, as suggested by the internet navigation system,” he said. “Somewhere near Begumpur in Bhajanpura, a group of men stopped his car. Initially, Basant refused to come out, but when they started damaging his car, he had to. They also checked his identity,” he claimed.

Situation in most parts of northeast Delhi, however, remained peaceful with police as well as paramilitary officers deployed in large numbers.

Meanwhile, the SIT team is focusing on murder cases first. Once investigation of these cases is streamlined, the probe will move on to other violent and assault cases, an officer said.

Cops have also been carrying out raids in search of suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain, who has been booked in the murder case of Ankit Sharma, an IB official whose body was fished out from a drain. Police sources revealed that Tahir switched off his phone on February 27 at 10pm. His last location was near Dayalpur. The mobile number of a man who was coordinating with the media on behalf of Tahir was also switched off, they added.

Title: Lorry crashes into house, no inmate injured
Content:
Hyderabad: A ready-mix concrete lorry crashed into a house located along the main road in Kanapur village in Narsingi on Sunday morning after the driver lost control of the vehicle. Luckily, the inmates of the house managed to escape unhurt.

Narsingi police said that the lorry was on its way to a construction site when the accident occured at around 5am. D Annavaram and his grandson were in the house at that time. Locals rushed to the spot and rescued them as well as the driver who sustained minor injuries.

The police have registered a case based on the complaint filed by the house inmates, who also claimed that there was property loss worth around Rs 2 lakh.

Title: Bulgarian tourist abducted by two in Delhi's Dwarka, taken for a ride
Content: NEW DELHI: Two men were arrested for robbing and then kidnapping a Bulgarian tourist from an ATM in southwest Delhi’s Dwarka Mod a few days ago.The duo had demanded a ransom of Rs 2 crore for his release. However, the police managed to rescue the victim, Palashev Rodaslav, and arrest the kidnappers late on Saturday.Both the accused, Anoop Dagar (36) and Naveen Dagar (29), are members of the Rajesh Bawania gang and belong to Jharoda Kalan village of southwest Delhi. Anoop is a notorious criminal and a land-grabber in the area. In 2014, he and his associates had murdered a property dealer in a dispute over a piece of land.At 10.30pm on Thursday, Rodaslav had gone to the ATM to withdraw money with his friend, George, also a Bulgarian. The two criminals saw them and got inside the ATM. They first robbed them of Rs 1 lakh and then asked Rodaslav to accompany them as they wanted more money. They took Rodaslav, while George rushed back to his apartment. He did not share the incident with anyone. Around midnight, he received a ransom call from the kidnappers demanding Rs 2 crore for Rodaslav’s release.Scared, George opened up to their common friend, Anand, whose apartment they were living in. Anand, a doctor by profession, had met the two in Armenia while pursuing an MBBS course and had invited them to India. Rodaslav is a software engineer, while George is a businessman. It’s their first visit to India.“Police was informed around 9.45am on Saturday. An FIR was registered at Mohan Garden Police Station and a special team was formed under DCP Anto Alphonse,” said Shalini Singh, joint commissioner (western range).Police scanned the CCTV footage from the ATM to identify the kidnappers and their vehicle’s registration number. The kidnappers kept switching their phones off, making it difficult to track them. “On Saturday afternoon, we finally traced them to a location on Najafgarh-Jharoda Kalan Road. We also received a tip-off that a foreign national was seen with two Indian men near Jharoda Kalan in a white car having a Haryana registration number,” DCP (Dwarka) Anto Alphonse said.The police team decided to lay a trap for the kidnappers at the spot in Jhraoda where George had been called alone to deliver the ransom.The cops were stationed in private vehicles and plain clothes. However, the kidnappers did not turn up, which indicated that they had sensed police presence. The cops then started scanning the nearby roads and fund a white i20 near Gate 2 of the CRPF camp in the area.When the vehicle was intercepted, the kidnappers opened fire at the police team. The cops opened fire too and flattened the car’s tyres. The criminals tried to run away, but were chased by the cops. A scuffle ensued in which three cops were injured, but they safely managed to rescue Rodaslav. The police found two pistols and Rs 1 lakh cash from the accused. An FIR of assault on police was also filed.

Title: Don’t spark panic over diseases, hammer out an action plan: Yogi Adityanath
Content:
Chief minister Yogi Adityanath offers fruits to children at the fifth Mukhyamantri Arogya Mela in Lucknow on S... Read More

LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath stressed on not creating panic over diseases, but focusing on solutions and making systematic action plans for tackling them.

Inaugurating the fifth Mukhyamantri Arogya Mela at the primary health centre in Aurangabad, Sarojininagar area of Lucknow on Sunday, Yogi said, “From 1977-78 to 2016, around 500 to 1,500 children died within three to four months every year because of dreaded Japanese encephalitis .”

“Instead of creating panic, our government focused on solutions and making a systematic action plan. We launched a massive campaign against the disease and the death toll due to JE has reduced by 90%, while the incidence is down by 60% in last three years,” Yogi said. Dengue and Kalazar can also be controlled like this, the CM added.

He urged media not to create fear in the name of diseases, and said, “When weather changes, people catch cold. It is flu, and the cause of its spread gives names like swine flu and bird flu. We need to make people aware about this. The health department should be alert and prepare a better action plan to fight the disease.”

He directed health department to prepare an action plan against flu and said special wards should be set up in hospitals in advance to stop it from spreading.

“A vaccination campaign is beginning today in which children from 1 to 15 years will be vaccinated. It will continue till March 31. ‘Dastak’ abhiyan workers will visit all primary health centers and secondary schools and vaccinate those who have not been vaccinated,” he said.

In April 2018, UP government had launched ‘Dastak’ campaign in 38 districts to beat encephalitis.

Four health fairs have been organized so far, in which more than 22 lakh people have received treatment, the chief minister added.

Title: Sweet deal: Sugar mills in UP clear dues of three years
Content:
Lucknow: In a big respite to cane growers in UP, their outstanding payments for past three years have been almost fully paid to them.

The UP cane department’s data shows that cane purchase dues have been paid 100% by corporation and cooperative sugar mills for 2016-17, 2017-18 and 2018-19, while private mills have cleared 99.91% dues for 2016-17, 99.87% for 2017-18 and 98.1% for 2018-19.

However, in the ongoing crushing season, the mills have paid Rs 11,096.90 crore, against total dues of Rs 19,239 crores, with Rs 8,142 crore — around 43% of total dues — still pending.

Data further shows that the three corporation mills paid only Rs 71.38 crore against total dues of Rs 248 crore, with Rs 176 crore still outstanding. Similarly, 24 cooperative mills have still to pay Rs 675 crore, while 92 private mills have still to clear Rs 7,290 crore to farmers. A senior official of cane department said, “The payment of dues was prioritized to ensure that the pending payments of previous years are cleared. Now, the dues of current season would be taken up.”

UP Sugar Mills Association (UPSMA), meanwhile, said mills are having huge buffer stock which is being sold in open market very slowly. “The sugar stock for festive season has been exhausted, resulting in lowering of prices,” said a UPSMA office-bearer.

Sugar experts said the millers are weighing the options of diverting part of molasses for manufacture of ethanol to meet financial crunch and generate funds to clear off cane dues to farmers.The cane dues in current crushing season are still high despite UP government not increasing the state advisory price for the third year in a row.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Rahul Gandhi, Kamal Haasan greet M K Stalin on birthday
Content:
M K Stalin (File Photo)

CHENNAI: Politicians including Rahul Gandhi and actor Kamal Haasan extended birthday greetings to DMK president M K Stalin, who turned 67 on Sunday. Celebrations were low key and Stalin had asked his party functionaries to not visit to greet him in person since party general secretary K Anbazhagan is hospitalised due to age-related ailments.

“My best wishes to @mkstalin on his birthday. May he be blessed with good health and happiness always,” former Congress president Rahul Gandhi said in a tweet.

Kamal Haasan tweeted in Tamil saying, “Birthday wishes to my loving brother @mkstalin. My hearty wishes for your voice to resonate for the people of the state for many days and against injustice happening in Tamil Nadu.”

Puducherry chief minister V Narayaswamy and VCK chief Thol Thirumavalavan were among other leaders who extended their wishes to Stalin.

DMK south Chennai unit organized a job camp in which around 100 companies were said to have participated and recruited youngsters. DMK youth wing leader Udhayanidhi Stalin was the chief guest and gave away recruitment orders, besides distributing welfare measures to the needy. DMK MP from South Chennai Thamizhachi Thangapandian and former Chennai mayor M Subramanian participated.

Title: Against norms, Nagpur Municipal Corporation stores scrap in basement parking of its building
Content:
The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) is duty bound to initiate action against unauthorized use of basement p... Read More

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) is duty bound to initiate action against unauthorized use of basement parking area but it seldom takes any steps. Now, flouting its own norms, the civic body has been caught storing scrap in the lower basement parking of its new administrative building in Civil Lines.

Despite being in use for the last seven years, the building is yet to secure fire compliance and occupancy certificates, which too are major violations as per the civic body’s own rules. TOI has reported this regularly in the past.

The seven-storey building is having parking space in lower and upper basements. Lower basement is in use since 2014 for two-wheelers. Four-wheelers are supposed to be parked in lower basement but it wasn’t in use until recently.

Tukaram Mundhe, soon after taking charge on January 28, got upset over haphazard parking of cars by employees and visitors on the sprawling premises in front of the building.

The NMC engineers then marked parking lots and started action against vehicles in no-parking areas. Car parking too started in the lower basement area.

A few days ago, some NMC employees and visitors alerted TOI about bad condition of the lower basement parking. Many old cupboards, chairs, tables, handcart etc were found dumped in the basement parking. While shifting offices from old to new building, employees of a few departments had dumped the scrap there.

Sewage water was found dripping from a damaged pipeline on high voltage electric cables bundled in a case attached to the ceiling. Puddles of black-coloured sewage water as well as scrap were giving out a stinking smell.

Adding to the problems was the poor lighting system in the basement. Also, there is only one ramp for entry and exit of vehicles. Cars parked by a few officials covered almost half the ramp.

Parking and moving around vehicles has become a problem due to the scrap and sewage water. People have to use staircase in absence of a lift.

TOI has sent pictures of scrap and sewage in lower basement parking to Mundhe. According to NMC officials, Mundhe has directed the engineers to clean basement parking immediately and the work has started. It will take sometime to stop the sewage flow. Fire systems have been installed and B-certificate is awaited from the agency concerned. Occupancy certificate will be issued after fire compliance certificate, they said.

The building was proposed in 2002 at the cost of Rs17.99 crore. Construction started in 2003 but missed the deadline of 2004. Only ground floor was completed till 2013. Till then, the cost had increased to Rs57 crore.

The then municipal commissioner Shyam Wardhane and additional municipal commissioner Hemant Kumar Pawar shifted their offices to ground floor so that the officials can expedite works. The building was brought into use in a phased manner.

Title: In view of SC’s Ayodhya verdict, VHP to celebrate 15-day Ram Mahotsav across country
Content:
Representative image

AGRA: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) has decided to have an extended celebration of Ram Mahotsav across the country from March 25 this year. During the 15-day event, the VHP would be honouring kar sevak who participated in the 1990 Ayodhya movement and then in the 1992 Babri demolition.

The celebrations, which earlier used to be for 7 days, have been extended to 15 days in view of the favourable SC judgment in the Ram Janmabhoomi case.

Announcing this, VHP’s international joint general secretary SK Jain said that the programmes will start across three lakh villages from March 25 and continue until Hanuman Jayanti , which falls on April 8. He said that every year Ram Utsav is celebrated during Ram Navami but this year the celebrations will be different in view of the apex court verdict in favour of Ram Temple.

According to Jain, every VHP activist wanted to celebrate this event immediately after the judgment, but the organisational leaders felt that it could hurt the sentiments of the other community. “Now is the right time to celebrate,” he said.

He told TOI that kar sevaks, who participated in 1990 and 1992 will also be felicitated during this period. “Workers will also visit villages, from where bricks to construct Ram temple were brought in Ayodhya,” he said, adding that communication will also be established with the Hindus, who are “disturbed due to the violence that broke out at several places after CAA was passed in Parliament”.

“Our aim is to spread Lord Ram’s message to every corner of the nation because people have forgotten it. That is the reason for such kind of disturbed atmosphere in the country,” Jain added.

According to VHP’s Braj region vice-president Sunil Parashar, “Workers will go to villages to garner support for the temple construction. Prabhat pheri, shobha yatras will be organised during this period.”

Title: Army factory forced to shut after leopard spotted to reopen today
Content:
Bareilly: The ordnance clothing factory (OCF) in Shahjahanpur Cantonment that temporarily shut its operations on Saturday and Sunday after a leopard was spotted in its premises is expected to resume work on Monday. Wildlife Trust of India (WTI) experts and forests officials who searched every nook and corner of the sprawling factory campus spread over 100 acres for the past two days could not find any fresh traces of the big cat. They have concluded that the animal has moved away from the campus.

Daksh Gangwar from WTI told TOI, “We have installed 12 cameras but there is a least possibility of the presence of the big cat in the factory. We are still staying cautious and monitoring the area.”

The experts have also identified three points from where the leopard may have entered the factory premises.

The big cat was initially spotted by security guards near the blanket manufacturing unit late on Friday night and later its presence was confirmed by CCTV cameras installed on the factory campus. An employee on the night shift captured a few pictures of the animal. Nearly 3,000 employees at the OCF were sent on leave on Saturday as a precaution.

On Saturday morning, a team of experts and foresters began combing the factory premises in search of the leopard. The search went on till Sunday evening, but no signs of the animal’s presence were found. The camera traps set up on campus also did not capture the big cat. All this indicated that it had moved out of the factory campus.

Anurag Yadav, public relationship officer, OCF, said, “We are starting operations from Monday as the forest department has suggested that the leopard has possibly moved out. The wildlife experts are still monitoring the area, using camera traps.”

ReplyForward

Title: Former babu conned by ‘Vibrant investor’
Content:
Ahmedabad: A retired bureaucrat of the state government has filed a complaint with Gandhinagar police stating that he was cheated of Rs 38,600 by a London-based woman who had contacted him in August 2018 enquiring on how to invest in the state during the Vibrant Gujarat Global Investors’ Summit-2019.

In his FIR with Sector-7 police of Gandhinagar, Dinesh Kapadia, a resident of Sector-4 who retired as member secretary in social justice and empowerment department, stated that the accused Benita Morgan contacted him on Facebook messenger in August 2018.

Morgan had then asked on how she would make investments in the Vibrant Gujarat Summit which was to be held in January 2019 at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar, said Kapadia in the FIR.

Kapadia said that he had just told her that he would guide her on the Vibrant Gujarat Summit and he did it “just on humanitarian ground”. Later, the woman told Kapadia that she would send her a memento out of respect for the help he had done.

On August 21, 2018, Kapadia got a call from a courier company where a man told him that he would need to pay money to get clearance for a parcel which was sent from London. As Kapadia had also received a receipt of that parcel from Morgan, he paid the money through NEFT, states the FIR.

On August 23, 2018, Kapadia again received a call from the courier company and this time he was told to pay Rs 80,000. The courier company told Kapadia to pay the money as the parcel contained a purse worth Rs 30,000 pounds.

Kapadia, this time, realized that he was being duped so he wrote to Delhi police commissioner about the cheating as the courier company was based in New Delhi. As the offence took place in jurisdiction of Gandhinagar police, Kapadia’s application was sent to Gandhinagar SP and finally the complaint was registered at Sector-7 police station.

Sector-7 police have registered a complaint of cheating .

Title: AMU docs organize candlelight vigil for Delhi riot victims
Content:
Agra: A candlelight vigil was organized in Aligarh Muslim University’s Medical College on Sunday to express solidarity with the people who had suffered irreparable loss of life and property in the recent attacks in northeast Delhi.

Resident Doctors’ Association (RDA) members handed over a memorandum addressed to President Ram Nath Kovind, through the local administration, demanding a fair inquiry into the violence and speedy justice to the victims by booking the culprits. They also urged the central and Delhi governments to take appropriate measures for confidence-building and rehabilitation of the victims.

The doctors appealed to all Indians to reject the divisive voices and remain united as true Indians during the “testing times”.

Meanwhile, AMU Teachers Association also condemned the violence, arson and loss of life in Delhi. Members of the association said such unlawful acts carried out and allowed to happen in front of Delhi Police is shameful and painful. AMUTA appealed for restraint to all stakeholders and urged n all citizens to maintain harmony.

Title: Land fraud accused nabbed from MP
Content:
Jaipur: City police have arrested one person who was part of a gang that ran a fake real estate company and duped people of crores of rupees, with a promise of giving them leases of land deeds which only existed on paper.

The person arrested was identified as 37-year-old Rajat Singhal, who was nabbed from Ujjain in Madhya Pradesh by Vaishali Nagar police team. “The accused along with his accomplices was part of the gang which took crores of money from people in return for plots which did not exist on ground. They promised the fraud victims of getting them plots in residential colonies in the city and after collecting crores of rupees, fled with the money,” said a police officer.

One of the members had previously been arrested while three were on the run including Singhal. This is the second arrest in the matter.

A team was formed to track down the accused and the official said, “We formed a team to trace the remaining accused and using human and cyber intelligence, finally found Singhal’s location. Our team went to MP and arrested one of the accused. We are further interrogating him to trace the location of others.”

There are a total of four members who ran the fraudulent company and there are a total of 47 cases against the accused in various police stations including Vaishali Nagar, which alone had 17 cases lodged by various complainants who were duped by the accused.

Title: State government approves Rs 3cr for mechanised cleaning
Content:
Agra: In a major boost to mechanised cleaning process, the state government has sanctioned Rs 3 crore for the purchase of five machines to improve sanitation and hygiene for areas like MG road, VIP road, i.e. from Kheria Airbase to Taj Mahal, and Jeewani Mandi.

“Soon, three street sweeping machines and two sprinklers will be purchased. The state authorities have given permission. The machines will help us in improving the cleanliness in different parts of the city,” additional municipal commissioner KB Singh said.

Notably, this is not the first that the Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) has gone ahead with mechanised cleaning process.

In 2018, the corporation had purchased 10 litter-picking machines to make the cleaning process dust-free on the MG Road and the vicinity of the Taj Mahal. These included two battery-mounted, four trolly-mounted and four backpack vacuum-litter-picking machines. While the first two functioned on batteries, the rest eight were operated by petrol.

However, three weeks after its use five of the machines broke down and remained non-functional due to lack of maintenance.

Moreover, it was alleged that the AMC administration, before handing over the litter-picking machines to the workers, did not teach the staff how to operate them. With at least five of the ten machines becoming non-functional, the plan stopped mid-way after a while and the workers were again deployed for manual cleaning.

Assuring that the past mistakes won’t be repeated, executive engineer, AMC, Rajiv Rathi told TOI, “This time, we will provide the required training to the sanitation workers on how to operate these machines and we will make sure that the new machines are well maintained.”

When asked about the repairing of the defunct five machines, Rathi said, “The litter picking machines are being repaired.”

Title: Delhi government starts distributing relief to families affected in riots
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: Delhi government on Sunday started distributing immediate financial assistance of Rs 25,000 to families affected in the recent violence in northeast Delhi.

A Delhi government statement said the officials in all four divisions of the violence-affected areas started distributing financial assistance as immediate relief to the victims at their doorstep. Some affected people also came directly to the offices of sub-divisional magistrate and got the amount, the statement said. The process of assessing the loss also continued on Sunday, it added.

Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal had earlier announced a compensation package and relief and rehabilitation measures for the victims and families affected in the violence. He had also announced a cash grant of Rs 25000 as immediate relief, to help bring the lives of the victims to normalcy.

The remaining amount of the compensation announced by the government will be given after completion of required formalities and paperwork, officials said.

According to officials, 69 people had applied for financial relief after the government started receiving applications on Saturday. Kejriwal had reviewed the relief and rehabilitation work at the North East district magistrate’s office and directed the officials to take necessary steps to provide compensation at the earliest.

Officials said a detailed list of victims was also being prepared. Counters have been set up at the district magistrate office to receive the applications. The government, meanwhile, has deployed 18 SDMs appointed in all affected divisions who are verifying the applications.

Meanwhile, Delhi environment minister Gopal Rai visited GTB Hospital on Sunday and met the injured.

Title: History-sheeter shot in encounter dies during treatment
Content:
BAREILLY: History-sheeter Karan, alias, Chotu — wanted in over dozen cases of robbery, road holdup, murder and carrying a bounty of Rs 15,000 — died during treatment after he was injured in an encounter in Maanpur village under Cantonment police station on late Saturday night.

The autopsy report confirmed that Karan didn ’t die due to bullet injury, but his viscera was preserved for a further lab test to ensure there was no foul play.

SSP Shailesh Pandey said, “Though Karan was a notorious criminal, police never wanted to kill him. He was shot in his leg. Unfortunately, his condition deteriorated due to low blood pressure and he died during treatment. The autopsy report also confirmed that he didn’t die due to the bullet injury.”

The body was handed over to Karan’s family in Bhabhiya village after the autopsy on Sunday.

The SSP Shailesh Pandey deployed extra police force in the village to maintain law and order situation. Karan (34) had killed a constable in 2013.

He was recently booked by Cantonment police for allegedly seeking extortion from a businessman.

Title: Retired mamlatdar cheated of Rs 52 lakh by postal agents in Ahmedabad
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A retired Mamlatdar, resident of the Vastrapur area of city, filed a complaint with Vastrapur police on Saturday alleging that two postal department agents — husband and wife, cheated him of Rs 51.85 lakh in garb of investments in various postal schemes.

Kishor Pandya, 64, resident of Goyal Plaza on Judges Bungalows Road, states in the FIR that the two accused — Haresh Srivastava and his wife Kajal Shah, residents of Satellite, took the money from him between 2010 and 2019 to invest in nine different accounts. But eight of those nine accounts were fake and they had deposited a meagre amount of Rs 14,000 in one account only.

Pandya said in the FIR that he treated the Srivastava and Shah like his own family.

The had approached him in 2010 to invest in recurring and savings account of postal department and promised good returns.

Convinced with this, Pandya had invested Rs 51.85 lakh in nine accounts and the couple gave him passbooks for different accounts which also had entries of investments in those passbooks, states the FIR.

In September 2019, Pandya checked his investments in Panjrapole branch of postal department and found that eight accounts were fake and seals of the department and entries were forged.

When Pandya questioned Shah, she told him that she will return his money. When Pandya did not get his money back for around seven months, he filed a complaint of cheating, breach of trust and forgery along with other charges under IPC.

Inspector M M Jadeja said that one of the accused — Haresh Srivastava had died last year, and Shah was yet to be arrested in the case.

Title: Flight takeoffs to get quicker as taxiway work nears completion
Content:
Chennai: The city airport will soon be able to reduce air traffic congestion during peak hours as work to construct taxiways linking the two runways and rapid exit taxiways is nearing completion. Work to link them will begin soon and is expected to be completed by this year end.

While one taxiway links the main and second runway, and the other connects to the main runway and runs parallel to it. Once completed, the taxiways will help planes move out of the runway faster and taxi to the parking bays. Landing and departures won’t be delayed.

“The work is being carried out in small portions so that flight operations are not be affected,” said an official. AAI has floated a tender to finish work pending on the two taxiways. Concreting work, digging a culvert and resurfacing of parking bays are going on near the VIP parking bays and cargo terminals.

The taxiways are part of the phase 2 airport expansion, to increase aircraft handling capacity. AAI aims for Chennai airport to be able to handle more than 40 flights an hour and allow more airlines to have night parking when all pending work is complete.

A bend on the taxiway that runs parallel to the main runway was a bottleneck that slowed down planes as they taxied to the Guindy-end of the main runway. “Straightening of the taxiway is almost complete and final surface work is going on. Work to complete rapid exit taxiways is also on,” said an official. This will speed up planes by at least 10 minutes during take-offs.

In addition to the taxiway work, AAI is also strengthening parking bays and apron bays so that larger planes can be parked and passengers can be boarded. Two parking bays have also been merged so that jumbo planes of the type of B747 can be parked.

The airside expansion work along with a new terminal, which will be ready by September, will augment capacity of the airport to 35 million passengers per year.

Title: To unclog Secunderabad station, SCR plans more halts across city
Content: HYDERABAD: In an attempt to decongest the Secunderabad railway station in the city, South Central Railway (SCR) is aiming to provide halts for express trains at Malkajgiri, Lingampally, Begumpet, Falaknuma, and Bolarum. With more than 229 trains running from the Secunderabad railway station, it sees an average daily footfall of 1.8 lakh passengers. According to SCR , the Secunderabad station has met its capacity with 10 platforms and there is no scope of expanding the physical infrastructure of the station given the area it is established in."We are aiming at developing different stations across the city as terminal stations to be able to disperse the passenger rush to other stations.Passengers have long been demanding that more express trains halt at Malkajgiri station due to tremendous increase in the number of passengers in the belt."Malkajgiri railway station already sees more than 3,500 passengers on an average per day. During discussions with authorities it has been acknowledged that if more trains halt here, the numbers will increase radically," said a member of Suburban Train and Bus Travellers Association."A number of passengers from the area have to board their trains from either Kacheguda or Secunderabad for the lack of an option," he added.To address the issue, SCR is now providing halts for ten express trains at Malkajgiri and around 20 express trains pass through it."We are also aiming at completing the development of Cherlapally station into a satellite terminal at a cost of Rs 221 crore within the next three years, the development works have begun," an SCR official told TOI, adding that the move should help in catering to the need of rail users from the outskirts of the city.Due to land hurdles, a six platform terminal station will be developed which should help with the running of MMTS trains across the routes, informed railway officials.With the fast expansion of the city along Gachibowli and Patancheru, Serilingampally has also emerged as an important station for the passengers in the suburbs."Serilingampally sees an average of 25, 000 passengers per day and around 100 trains including MMTS, passenger, express and other long-distance trains run through it," said the SCR official.To cater to the passengers in western parts of the city, SCR is also extending the facilities in Lingampally as a terminal station where at present 40,000 passengers commute through it per day."An impressive number of 108 MMTS trains, 14 pairs of express and mail trains along with eight pairs of passenger trains halt at the station," a senior railway official told TOI."We are using the MMTS station as a rail transit hub to decongest the busy terminals like Secunderabad, Kacheguda and Hyderabad. We will soon be linking with the station in the future by extension of trains or additional stoppages," he added saying that the move will help see an additional 20,000 passengers daily.In the last couple of years, the authorities are working on improving the infrastructure at Lingampally to provide rail connectivity while taking the passenger heat off Sunderabad railway station as the rail users demands a full-fledged rail terminal at Lingampally.

Title: Delhi violence: Owners take stock of losses as shops open
Content:
Remains of Chand Bagh protest site after communal riots in north east Delhi on February 28

NEW DELHI: Inside colonies where violence broke out, life is slowly picking up. Several people came out to open their shops on Saturday evening and Sunday. “I opened my shop yesterday after the tension reduced. Not much harm has happened in the interiors. But why take a chance? It’s the common man who suffers,” said a Confectionery owner.

His brother added, “The DCP came and told us that we should open the shops now so that people realise that things are getting back to normal. However, on Saturday, I closed the shop early by 5pm.”

Another resident of Khajuri Khas Gali No. 2 and the owner of a sweets shop, echoed the sentiments. “The moment trouble started, I downed the shutters and left. Thank god no harm has come to my shop. There are many whose shops and homes have been completely burned.”

In some colonies, people were seen returning to their homes. “I went and stayed with my relatives in Seemapuri for a few days. I came back this morning as it is peaceful now,” said a 24-year-old. Some families were even leaving to attend family weddings. “Since normalcy has sort of returned, we can now go and attend a relative’s wedding in Uttar Pradesh. Life has to move on,” said a woman.

The rebuilding process has started too. On Sunday, the owners of a chicken shop at Karawal Nagar that had been completely destroyed was visited by SDM of the area. Three brothers who live in the building were handed over papers to write down the details. “The ceiling of the house can fall anytime. We are very scared. The SDM has seen it, but he did not tell us whether each of us will get compensation,” said one of them.

Title: NDA united, to win over 200 seats in Bihar assembly election: CM Nitish Kumar
Content:
Nitish Kumar

PATNA: Sounding the bugle for the forthcoming assembly polls, JD(U) chief and CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday said if voted to power for the next term, he would do more development work and provide irrigation water to each farm land across the state.

In his 100-minute speech while addressing the party’s ‘Karyakarta Sammelan’ here, Nitish recounted the sector-wise works done by his government during the last 15 years while comparing the state’s current situation with the 15-year regime of Lalu-Rabri (1990-2005).

Trying to dispel confusion among the party workers over his recent meeting with RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav in the state assembly, Nitish said nothing as such (thing) happens if someone comes to meet him. “The NDA is united in Bihar and let us resolve to ensure NDA’s victory with more than 200 seats in the forthcoming assembly polls,” he told the party workers.

Referring to the ongoing controversy over the CAA/NRC/NPR in the country, Nitish said he and his party would not tolerate any kind of injustice and negligence (upeksha) with the members of minority community. “The state government sent a letter to the Centre on February 15 to implement the old 2010 format of National Population Register (NPR) only. PM Narendra Modi himself has cleared confusion over the NRC. We also passed a resolution in the state assembly about the NPR and NRC,” he said.

“As far as the CAA is concerned, the matter is before the Supreme Court. People should have patience till the verdict. Some people are trying to create a situation like 1947 on the CAA issue, but this country is united. It is not going to be divided,” the JD(U) chief said.

Reiterating his demand of caste-based Census, Nitish said, “It is very necessary for many purposes. Once the accurate data of castes is available, it will be helpful in determining the percentage of quota for different reserved castes.”

Nitish said as long as he was in power, ban on liquor would not be lifted. “We are proceeding towards de-addiction,” he said, adding, ”At a meeting of eastern zonal council, I asked the chief ministers of West Bengal and Jharkhand to check liquor smuggling from their states in Bihar.”

Recounting the works done in the health sector, the CM also announced to inaugurate Karpoori Thakur Medical College and Hospital at Madhepura on March 7.

Nitish said he would soon prepare a booklet on the works done by his government and provide it to the party’s booth-level workers. “The workers will go to people and inform them about the works done by us and what was the situation in the state before 2005.”

Reminding that the booth level workers have to play important role during the coming election, Nitish said they should also provide people’s feedback to the party on the government’s work. He asked JD(U) national general secretary (organization) RCP Singh to prepare the workers for taking feedback from the public.

Regarding minority community, Nitish said, “I am not concerned for votes. But people of minority community must remember what works were done for them by the previous governments. People of one family continued to rule the state for 15 years. Prior to them, Congress was in power. But what they did for you. What was the fate of Bhagalpur riot cases? The Bhagalpur riot cases were reopened after we came to power in 2005.”

Earlier, JD(U) state chief Bashishtha Narain Singh called upon the party workers to go in the ‘mahasamar’ of 2020 with the face of Nitish Kumar and works done by his government.

Title: ‘Goli maaro...’ heard along Kolkata rally route
Content: KOLKATA: The slogan ‘ Goli maaro saalon ko (shoot the traitors)’ reared its incendiary head in the heart of central Kolkata on Sunday, with a group of BJP supporters headed to Union home minister Amit Shah ’s rally attempting to shout down anti-CAA protesters assembled along the route. Cops had a tough time keeping the two groups away from each other as the anti-CAA side responded with cries of “Halla bol (raise your voice)”.The slogan pierced through the cacophony of traffic in front of The Oberoi Grand in Kolkata around 2pm, when 200-odd protesters carrying “Go Back Amit Shah” banners ran into the group of BJP supporters walking towards the Dorina crossing. The police swung into action immediately, positioning themselves in the middle of the road to prevent the situation from escalating.Organisations like the No-NRC Movement later announced a campaign against the “hate slogan” from Monday.State BJP general secretary Sayantan Basu defended the “Goli maaro..” slogan making its debut in Kolkata. “How else do you expect people to react? They (BJP supporters) have seen propaganda and fake news being peddled over the past couple of weeks. That has sparked their anger, and they are now identifying anti-national forces,” he said.

Title: ‘Goli maaro...’ heard along Kolkata rally route
Content:
Union minister Amit Shah, flanked by leaders Kailash Vijayvargiya, right and Dilip Ghosh (AP)

KOLKATA: The slogan ‘ Goli maaro saalon ko (shoot the traitors)’ reared its incendiary head in the heart of central Kolkata on Sunday, with a group of BJP supporters headed to Union home minister Amit Shah ’s rally attempting to shout down anti-CAA protesters assembled along the route. Cops had a tough time keeping the two groups away from each other as the anti-CAA side responded with cries of “Halla bol (raise your voice)”.

The slogan pierced through the cacophony of traffic in front of The Oberoi Grand in Kolkata around 2pm, when 200-odd protesters carrying “Go Back Amit Shah” banners ran into the group of BJP supporters walking towards the Dorina crossing. The police swung into action immediately, positioning themselves in the middle of the road to prevent the situation from escalating.

Organisations like the No-NRC Movement later announced a campaign against the “hate slogan” from Monday.

State BJP general secretary Sayantan Basu defended the “Goli maaro..” slogan making its debut in Kolkata. “How else do you expect people to react? They (BJP supporters) have seen propaganda and fake news being peddled over the past couple of weeks. That has sparked their anger, and they are now identifying anti-national forces,” he said.

Title: SCCL seeks MoEF nod to mine coal within 10km of Shivaram sanctuary
Content:
Hyderabad: The Singareni Collieries Company Limited (SCCL) has sought approval from the ministry of environment and forests (MoEF) for mining within a 10km radius of Shivaram Wildlife Sanctuary in Peddapalli district.

“Number of coal-based thermal and cement plants were established in Ramagundam region considering the proximity of SCCL mines. The company has signed long-term fuel supply agreements with these industries by ensuring uninterrupted coal supplies. The proposed project will sustain existing linkage of coal supply to NTPC Ramagundam and cement plants in the region,” SCCL said in its proposals submitted to MoEF.

Though the mine is almost 7km away from the sanctuary, it falls under the proposed eco-sensitive zone. However, the environment ministry is yet to notify the zone. If the project is approved, the new coal mine will occupy 195 hectares of the eco-sensitive zone and 173 hectares of space outside the zone.

In its application to the standing committee of the National Board for Wildlife Clearance (NBWC), SCCL said, “The proposed cluster of Godavarikhani opencast-cum-underground coal mine will be set up at a distance of 7.7 km from the Shivaram Wildlife Sanctuary. As the environment ministry has not declared the eco-sensitive zone, permissions have to be obtained from the NBWC standing committee.”

“Coal mining is site-specific and so no alternative sites can be considered. It is proposed to extract 33.3 metric tonne of coal locked in an underground mine of Godavarikhani No. 5 incline by opencast method. If it is not extracted by surface mining, it will be lost forever. The proposed underground to opencast conversion project falls within 10km of Shivaram Wildlife Sanctuary. External dumping of earthen material is planned to be stacked utilising vacant land available between two villages adjacent to the quarry,” the company stated.

SCCL, the only coal producing company in south India jointly owned by the state and central governments, has been carrying out mining for more than 130 years. It currently operates 29 underground and 19 opencast mines in six districts — Kumaram Bheem, Mancherial, Peddapalli, Jayashankar Bhupalapalli, Bhadradri Kothagudem and Khammam.

Title: 4L volunteers hit the road at break of dawn to deliver pension to 49L
Content:
Amaravati: In a huge relief to the elderly and physically disabled of the state, village and ward secretaries distributed welfare pensions at their doorsteps on Sunday.

Despite it being a holiday, over four lakh volunteers and nearly 80,000 staff in the village and ward secretariats worked overtime to disburse pension early in the day. By 3pm, over 49 lakh beneficiaries received pension against the total 60 lakh. Senior officials and ministers monitored the distribution process on a real-time basis and expressed satisfaction about the speedy disbursement of funds. On an average, it takes 7-10 days to disburse pension to beneficiaries.

Proving determination to work as per chief minister YS Jagan Mohan’s ambition, the volunteers attached to the village and ward secretariats started work by 5am.

Upon learning about an elderly man from Gattu village of B Kothakota mandal in Chittoor district being admitted to Madanapalle government hospital, a young volunteer, Anand, went all the way to the hospital to hand over his pension. Similarly, another volunteer in Vajrakarur mandal went to an agriculture field to distribute pension of a woman.

Taking the completion of the target as a challenge, the volunteers chalked out a detailed action plan on Saturday itself and started disbursing pension on Sunday. The volunteers distributed nearly Rs 1,384 crore to the different categories of beneficiaries including the elderly, disabled, victims of chronic diseases and transgender persons. “This is the strength of the village/ward secretariat system that has been introduced by YS Jagan. We are taking governance to the next level,” said Panchayat Raj minister Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy.

Rural development and Panchayat Raj principal secretary Gopalakrishna Dwivedi, who worked as chief electoral officer during the general elections, monitored pension distribution almost like conducting polls, releasing hourly pension disbursement data.

The village volunteers distributed nearly 11 per cent of the pensions by 7am and took it to nearly 25 per cent by 10am. “Over 80 per cent of the pensions were distributed to beneficiaries at their doorstep by 2pm ,” Dwivedi said.

Civil supplies minister Kodali Nani said the amount spent on pensions in January, 2019 when Naidu was at the helm of affairs was just around Rs 490 crore, while their government disbursed a whopping Rs 1,384 crore in a single day.

He said it would be better for the TDP to completely shut down business as people were content with YSRC’s policies and schemes.

Title: UPSRTC to set up ticket counters in neighbouring states
Content:
Agra: Uttar Pradesh State Roadways Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) will be opening ticket booking counters in the neighbouring states. In the first phase, the counters will be set up in Haridwar, Dehradun, Haldwani and Jaipur. Through these counters, passengers will be able to book advance tickets in all the categories of UPSRTC buses.

At present, UPSRTC has no ticket booking counter in any state. The passengers have to take a ticket in the bus. They also suffer inconvenience due to lack of information about the timing of the bus.

Taking cognizance of the problems faced by the passengers from outside UP, UPSRTC managing director Raj Shekhar has ordered to set up the ticket booking counters in major stations of the neighbouring states.

MK Trivedi, UPSRTC regional manager, said, “By end of March, ticket booking counters will be set up in Jaipur, Haldwani, Dehradun and Haridwar. Such counters will also be set up in Madhya Pradesh, Delhi, Haryana. Duties of employees from Agra region will be assigned at these counters.”

Title: UP: Woman beats infant daughter to death as husband refuses to buy her clothes for Holi
Content:
Representative image

AGRA: A 25-year-old woman allegedly beat her six-month-old daughter to death in Aligarh’s Rampur village on Saturday evening after her husband refused to buy her and the children new clothes ahead of Holi.

According to police, accused Pinky Sharma and her husband Rahul had an argument on Saturday evening when the latter refused to go to the market to buy new clothes as he was unwell. Frustrated, Pinky vented her anger on her infant daughter Soni and thrashed her badly resulting in her death.

Based on a complaint lodged by Rahul, police registered a case against Pinky under section 302 (murder) of IPC and arrested her.

Jawan station in-charge Naresh Kumar Singh said that Pinky told police that she did not kill her daughter intentionally. He added that she was frustrated with domestic issues and constant arguments with her husband and took out her frustration on her daughter on Saturday not knowing that she would die.

Sources said that Pinky got married to Rahul, a lock factory labourer, four years ago and they have a three-year-old son too.

Title: Study centres in Avadi to soon help students get exam-ready
Content:
Chennai: Soon, aspirants from the western suburbs preparing for competitive exams will have a peaceful place to study in the whole day, with high speed internet, good toilets and a dining space. The Avadi Corporation has planned to construct study centres in its limits, Avadi corporation commissioner N Ravichandran told TOI.

“Work order for this will be given soon. This is a new concept that was tried out in the Trichy Corporation. The study centres will also have coffee machines for the aspirants,” he said.

This move is aimed to help those aspiring to crack exams by Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), TNPSC or other competitive exams, but lack a comfortable study environment.

Avadi is located around 30km from Chennai city and is connected to Chennai through regular bus and train services. However, it is a commute that can take anywhere between 45 minutes to two hours one way, in case a student wants to come to the Anna Centenary library or similar institutions to study in peace.

The Avadi Corporation has also planned to have open gyms at Rs 10 lakh each in 16 of its parks, with equipment like the ones found in parks under Greater Chennai Corporation. The parks that will have the facility are St Francis Park, Venkatachalam Nagar, SVT Nagar, Thendral Nagar, Vivekananda Nagar, TNHB Park in Thirumullaivoyal, Anthony Nagar, Ashok Niranjan Nagar, Paruthipattu, TNHB Avadi Park, Lazar Nagar (2nd and 5th street), Kavarapalayam, Drivers Colony, Balaji Nagar and Modern City Park.

Ravichandran said the spaces would be senior citizen-friendly.

A selfie spot and a water fountain might be installed within the newly anointed corporation’s limits if plans part of a beautification drive are executed, Ravichandran said.

Title: Rain, hail damage 1,500 hectare of irrigation land
Content:
Jaipur/Alwar: Unexpected rainfall and hailstorm affected the crops adversely in some parts of eastern Rajasthan including Dausa, Alwar and Bharatpur districts. Farmers in these regions are jittery and are apprehending heavy crop loss. Jaipur Met office on Sunday said that hailstorm and thunder showers will continue in some parts of eastern and western Rajasthan.

In Alwar district, preliminary reports suggested that rainfall and hailstorm have damaged 1,500 hectare of irrigation land . After the rough weather in Alwar district on Saturday night, crops were heavily damaged in many areas.

On Sunday morning, when the farmers visited their fields, they realized the damage to their crops. Although there was hailstorm in the entire district, public representatives of the area also visited some places in the district to assess the situation.

Minister of states for labour Tikaram Julie visited the villages affected by hailstorm in the district and took stock of the crops. “The state government is committed to providing all possible help to the farmers as per rules,” he said.

In the preliminary assessment, the department of agriculture maintained that nearly 15 to 20 per cent loss has been reported in about 1,500 hectare of irrigation land. Hailstorm and rainfall continued in Alwar, Bansur, Behror, Bayana, Bharatpur and some parts in Dausa district.

Attributing the continued hailstorm and rainfall to the active western disturbances and prevailing upper air cyclonic circulation, Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the eastern and western parts of the state in the next 24 hours. Due to the hailstorm and rain , there was a fall of almost 3°C in the minimum and maximum temperatures.

People in Jaipur woke up to comparatively chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 15°C was recorded. Though cloudy conditions prevailed in and around the city, it did not convert into rainfall. In its forecast, Jaipur Met office said that many places in the state are likely to witness hailstorm and rain in the next 24 hours. In Jaipur, minimum temperature of 14°C or below will be witnessed on Monday.

Title: Neighbour tries to rape woman
Content:
Ahmedabad: A 29-year-old woman from the Bodakdev area on Sunday filed a complaint of molestation against a man, 30, her neighbour, alleging that he had tried to rape her late on Saturday night.

She stated that the man had also molested her earlier regarding which she had filed a complaint with Vastrapur police. As the man carried a grudge, he had on Saturday night barged into her house and attempted rape.

In her FIR filed with Vastrapur police on Sunday, the woman states that her husband was not at home when the incident took place.

“My husband had gone for some work for two days. When someone knocked on the door, I thought my husband had come. When I opened the door, I found my neighbour there,” she states in the FIR.

“Before I could do something, he pushed me and entered my home. He, then pinned me down on the floor and tried to rape me.”

When the woman resisted, the accused dragged her by her hair and beat her. The woman started screaming for help and her 10-year-old son rushed in and tried to rescue her. But the accused beat him up as well.

Meanwhile, the woman’s mother-in-law and other residents of her housing society rushed there. The accused then left but after threatening her that she will face dire consequences if she dared to go to the police again.

The woman approached Vastrapur police on Sunday and filed a complaint of molestation, assault and criminal intimidation against the man.

Title: Need a responsible social media: Kishan
Content:
Hyderabad: Union minister of state for home G Kishan Reddy on Sunday said rumours, spread by political parties and sections in social media, added fuel to the fire in the recent Delhi violence. “The Modi government is determined to get to the bottom of the truth to unravel the conspiracy, if any, that triggered the riots in Delhi,” he said at ‘ISB Policy Conclave-Ideas for India 2020 and Beyond’ on Sunday.

“The Centre has been able to control the situation in violence-hit parts of Delhi,” he added.

The minister said many lives were lost and there was property loss too. “A constable of Delhi Police and an IB officer had become victims of evil designs. We have been able to control the situation,” he added.

Expressing concern that social media cannot be a misinformation tool, he said: “It is time to discuss about how social media can be more responsible. “Issues can be resolved by discussion. It is difficult to understand why a section of people invariably stays away from dialogue and indulges in rumour-mongering,” he added.

He reiterated that the CAA would not take away citizenship of any Indian, but grant it to persecuted religious minorities from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. “People who criticise the government suffer from selective amnesia,” he added.

“India respected its commitment on protecting the rights of minorities, but Pakistan violated and religious minorities have been facing attacks instigated by the state,” he alleged.

Title: As govt plans new menu, will fruit replace mutton at jails?
Content:
Vijayawada: The prisons department may stop serving mutton to inmates. The red meat, which is currently being served once a month, may go off the menu as authorities are having trouble procuring it from suppliers at prices agreeing with their funds. Likely to take its place are fruit and vegetable salads. Chicken is served thrice a month.

In the recently concluded state-level retreat programme to formulate new prison and correction policies, officials of the prisons department proposed changes in the menu for inmates for a healthy diet.

Speaking to TOI, DIG Prisons, coastal Andhra range, Dr Indla Sreenivasa Rao said since they were finding it difficult to procure quality mutton from vendors and suppliers. “As we are not getting suppliers who comply with norms, we have decided to approach the government for guidance. We may serve fruit and vegetable salads once a month instead of mutton,” he said. Apart from fruit, inmates will also be served boiled eggs twice a week instead of once as is being done currently. “Egg is cheap compared to any other protein-rich food,” Sreenivasa Rao said.

In what can be looked at as a solitary ray of hope, prisoners can look forward to better rice. “Recently, a representation was sent to the AP government to improve the quality of rice served in prisons in the state as inmates expressed difficulty eating the coarse rice currently being supplied,” said Director General of Prisons and Correctional Services, Andhra Pradesh Md Ahsan Reza.

The prisons department is presently buying rice from the Civil Supplies department at Rs 30 a kg.

The prisons department has listed a slew of measures for the rehabilitation of prisoners. “We have requested the AP government to list all the convicts under Aarogyasri Health Scheme so that they get quality medication,” said Ahsan Reza.

Title: 24-yr-old commits suicide in city
Content:
Jaipur: A 24-year-old woman committed suicide in Kalwar police station area on Sunday morning by hanging herself from the ceiling fan. Police have found no suicide note and the reason behind the suicide is still being investigated.

The deceased was identified as Rabiya Bano who hung herself using a ‘dupatta’. Rajesh Chaudhary, SHO, Kalwar police station said, “The incident happened around 9am on Sunday when Rabiya went to her room and hung herself from the ceiling fan. Her family was in the house at the time of the incident though they claim they had no inkling that she would do something like this.”

Cops are yet to ascertain the reason behind the suicide and the official added, “As of now we have no clue as to the reason behind the suicide and even the deceased’s family is unable to give us any idea as to the possible reason for the same. They claim that there was no indication that Rabiya was thinking along these lines.”

The deceased was pursuing Bachelor of education and was looking forward to work as a teacher after completing the course.

“We will check her mobile phone as well to find clues which led her to take such an extreme step. We will also check her call records to find the person that she spoke to last before killing herself. Hopefully once we get more details, there will be more clarity in the case. We will also question her friends and acquaintances in case they can shed some light on the matter. We are not ruling out any possibilities at this stage,” said the official.

The girl was found hanging by her family when she did not open her room door despite repeated knocking. Police was informed and Rabiya taken to hospital where she was declared dead. Her body was handed over to the family after post-mortem.

Title: Ahmedabad: Minor girl raped, videos circulated; two held
Content:
The main accused in police custody

AHMEDABAD: A 15-year-old girl from Sardarnagar was allegedly raped several times by her boyfriend from school. The accused used to allegedly ask the girl to send her nude photographs and also filmed the sexual assaults.

The girl has told the cops that these events unfolded over six months. She said the accused used to send the photographs to his friends, who then stalked the girl and asked for sexual favours. When she refused their demands, they uploaded the videos.

The inspector of Sardarnagar police station, Hemant Patel, said that the main accused has been held. One of his three friends, who had made the videos viral, has also been arrested by police.

“We have registered two complaints, one for the rape and one for making the videos viral,” Patel said.

“The complaints have been made under POCSO and IT Acts.”

He said that the two accused who are still on the run will be arrested soon. “We have seized the mobile phone of the accused and are taking the help of the cybercrime cell to analyze it,” Patel said.

According to the complaint lodged by the girl’s father, she had fallen in love with the accused.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Brakes on Azam Khan case cost SP his post?
Content:
Azam Khan

LUCKNOW: Barely 45 days into the job as superintendent of police, Rampur, Santosh Mishra was shunted out of the politically-sensitive district, also the pocket borough of SP leader Azam Khan . Shagun Gautam has been put at the helm after the Sunday morning churning in IPS cadre by the Yogi government.

Insiders told TOI Mishra’s transfer was not routine. He was moved out because he failed to file a chargesheet in at least 47 FIRs against Azam during his six-week tenure. Mishra’s appointment in January followed a corruption complaint against his predecessor, Ajay Pal Sharma , by then Noida SSP Vaibhav Krishna, that stirred controversy in IPS circles. An out-of-favour Mishra has been made SP, Police Headquarters, Prayagraj. Just a day before Sharma was transferred out of Rampur, the belligerent cop publicly announced on a loudspeaker in Ganj police station area, asking Azam Khan to appear in court. But the tables were turned when Santosh Mishra took over reins. He slammed brakes on any action against Azam, citing protocol in case of a serving MP and did not review pending cases.

“Two members of a family who had gone to lodge a case against the SP leader were also reprimanded and shown the door by senior police officers in Rampur,” said Faisal Lala , a social activist in Rampur.

Soon after 2019 Lok Sabha poll, the government shifted then SP Rampur Shiv Hari Meena and appointed Ajay Pal Sharma, who had 190 encounters to his credit. Sharma lodged 65 FIRs against Azam and family in just four months, taking the tally to 88 by the time he moved out. Rampur police said a chargesheet in 41 cases were lodged, but 47 cases were still pending.

Title: Experts find allergy-causing pollen in air
Content:
Jaipur: Doctors have come out with a warning for those suffering with allergies as for the first time in the season, pollens of Holoptelea trees have been detected in the air. The first pollen of the season was detected in the city on Saturday. For next two months, the pollen is expected to remain in the air, taking a toll on the health of the people who are sensitive to it.

Holoptelea trees are in abundance in the city, especially in public parks including the Central Park, where hundreds of morning walkers go to every morning to get some fresh air and to keep themselves fit. The machine for pollen count installed at a private hospital in Vidyadhar Nagar detected 16 pollen of Holoptelea, signalling alarm to the patients sensitive to it. The counts represent number of pollens per cubic metre of air in 24 hours.

According to health experts, these pollens are known to cause exacerbation of symptoms in patients with allergic rhinitis (AR) and asthma. However, doctors have advised that the people sensitive to these pollens should restrict their outdoor activities, especially in the mornings and evenings.

“It is seen that the peak of pollen count is in the mornings and evenings. People should not go out at these times. If it is necessary to go out for the patients sensitive to these pollens, they should wear a three-layer mask to prevent these pollens from entering the respiratory tract,” said Dr Nishtha Singh, executive director and chest consultant of a private hospital. She added that almost 10% of the asthma patients are sensitive to the Holoptelea pollen.

Despite the Holoptelea tree causing health-related problems, civic bodies are promoting its plantation. A lot many people are not aware about the ill-effects of the tree. The trees can be easily seen in public parks, Gandhi Nagar and other such areas. When people go for walks in these sarks, the pollens trigger allergy and they fall ill.

According to the SMS Hospital officials, the cases related to allergies increase during March and April.

People come complaining of runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes. Also, among asthma patients, it causes difficulty in breathing.

City-based doctors have already conducted a research — ‘Correlation of pollen counts and number of hospital visits of asthmatic and allergic rhinitis patients’, showing that there were two peaks of pollen count in a year — during March–April and August–October. Major part of the first peak was in March, and it had Holoptelea (65%) as the major contributor.

An earlier study done in Jaipur in 1957–1958 showed that the number of respiratory allergy patients in allergy clinics was proportionate to the fluctuation in the pollen count.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Class XII exams under new syllabus begin today
Content: CHENNAI: After a year-long preparation under the new syllabus, state board Class XII students will appear for board exams from Monday. The exams start with the language paper. The 8.16 lakh students set to appear for the exams, and their teachers and parents, are excited and anxious as the exams will show how they cope with a heavier syllabus.To prepare state board students for competitive exams like National Eligibility-cum-Entrance Test (NEET), the school education department revised syllabus and updated school textbooks in June.The directorate of government examinations, along with state government, has made an elaborate arrangement to conduct the exams smoothly following question paper leaks during half-yearly exams. “The 296 strong rooms where question papers are being kept were brought under heavy security cover with four armed policemen guarding each centre. These centres are monitored 24X7 through CCTV cameras,” an official from the examination department said.Security has been beefed up to prevent any tampering while ferrying question papers or answer scripts. As many as 4,000 flying squads will run checks to prevent malpractices during the exams.A special exam centre has also been set up at Puzhal prison for 62 inmates who will give Class XII board exams this year. From Chennai, 47,264 students are set to write the exam at 160 centres. The exams will end on March 24 and results are to be released on April 24.

Title: Telangana governor Tamilisai Soundararajan may follow Kerala counterpart on CAA
Content:
Tamilisai Soundararajan

HYDERABAD: With TRS opposing the Citizen (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) in Parliament and even planning to move a resolution against the law and seek modification in National Population Register ( NPR ) proforma in the assembly, the upcoming budget session is likely to be an encore of the events in Kerala. The Telangana assembly’s budget session will begin on March 6.

During the Kerala Assembly’s budget session Kerala governor Arif Mohammed Khan, in his speech, read out a paragraph against CAA. “I’m going to read this para because CM (Pinarayi Vijayan) wants me to read this, although, I hold the view this doesn’t come under the policy or programme. But CM has said this is the view of the government and to honour his wish I’m going to read this para,” the governor said before reading the para on CAA during his Assembly address.

“Our citizenship can never be on the basis of religion as this goes against the grain of secularism, which is part of the basic structure of our Constitution,” he said, referring to the resolution against CAA passed by the Kerala Assembly.

The Telangana Assembly’s budget session would begin on March 6 with governor Tamilisai Soundararajan ’s addressing the joint sitting of the House. Sources said the government would definitely incorporate its view on CAA, NPR and National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) in the governor’s address.

“The governor’s speech is being prepared and will be sent to Raj Bhavan in a couple of days. There will be mention about CAA, NRC and NPR,” highly-placed sources in the government said.

Before her appointment as Telangana governor , Tamilisai Soundararajan was president of BJP’s Tamil Nadu unit. Analysts said she might also follow her Kerala counterpart if there was anything against CAA as the governor cannot deny or modify the government-prepared speech.

Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao has been critical about CAA and even the party opposed the law in the Parliament. He also announced that he would hold a public meeting or conference with likely-minded CMs of other states and party heads in Hyderabad. On a couple of occasions, he reiterated that the Telangana Assembly would pass a resolution against CAA and send it to the Centre.

TRS friendly party AIMIM has been mounting pressure on KCR to stall NPR in the state.

In the wake of riots in Delhi and CAA protests in the state, some TRS MLAs held meetings with Muslim leaders in their respective constituencies. Since the anti-CAA protests were happening in the state and MIM president and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi was spearheading them, BJP’s Telangana unit has decided to hold pro-CAA meeting in Hyderabad on March 15.

Title: Three children among four killed in Rajsamand mishap
Content:
Udaipur: Four people, including three children, were killed while 22 were injured when a private bus going towards Jaipur from Ahmedabad overturned on National Highway 8 near Mada ki Bassi village under Diwer police station of Rajsamand district.

The victims were rushed to nearby Deogarh government hospital and eight of them are said to be critical.

According to police, around 8.30am, a private bus that was heading towards Jaipur overturned due to high speed as the driver lost control of the vehicle. Some 40 people were inside the bus when the mishap took place. Four passengers – Dakshita, 3, Aliya, 7, Dev Pratap, 12, son of Abhay Singh, of Ahmedabad died on the spot while a woman succumbed to her injuries on the way to the hospital, 22 others were injured. The bus was speeding when it overturned. Chaos prevailed in the area as passengers shouted for help. Diwer and Deogarh police teams reached the accident spot and began the rescue operation by shifting the bus from the road with the help of a crane. A 2-km long blockade was seen on the road affecting traffic which was restored after three hours. The passengers in the bus hailed from Ahmedabad, Nathdwara, Sikar, Ajmer and Karnataka, police said.

Title: 2BHK housing scheme: Revanth plans protest
Content:
Hyderabad: Telangana Congress working president A Revanth Reddy on Sunday said he will launch agitational programmes, including dharnas, rasta roko and bandh, from April if the TRS government fails to complete 2-BHK housing units and allot it to the homeless poor in and around Greater Hyderabad by March-end.

Stating that his week-long yatra ‘Ppatnam ghosha’ was not aimed at wooing voters, but to know first-hand problems being faced by them, Revanth said a large number of poor families in his Malkajgiri parlimentary constituency were waiting for the TRS government to allot them 2-BHK units.

“During my Patnam Ghosha yatra, people told me they were not able to pay the ever-increasing house rents in the city. They said their travails of paying rents will end once 2-BHK units promised by CM KCR are allotted to them,” Revanth said.

He alleged contractors stopped work on the project as the government has not paid Rs 900 crore pending bills to them. “Municipal minister KT Rama Rao should answer on diversion of funds from the Centre and loans from HUDCO to other sectors. Why is KTR silent during the ongoing ‘Pattana Pragathi’ programme. There are also allegations that KCR’s relatives have sold off some of 2-BHK units in Siddipet,” Revanth alleged.

Title: FIR taken 3 years after man duped of Rs 45k
Content:
Ahmedabad: It took Jayanti Panchal, 64, of Shahibaug, three years to navigate the maze of bureaucracy and finally succeed in lodging an FIR about Rs 45,000 stolen from his bank account by fraudsters. Panchal said for the last three years he has been roaming from office to office submitting applications, without any recourse.

Panchal stated in his complaint, finally accepted by the cybercrime cell, that on February 7, 2017, one Anita Singh had called him up and introduced herself as an executive of a private bank. “She told Panchal his credit card is about to expire and to transfer his bonus points to his new card she will need his 16-digit credit card number and other details. She said the new card will be sent to him by post,” said a police official.

After a few days, another woman, Radhika Patel, phoned Panchal, took his card number, his password and asked him to give her the OTP which he was to receive on his mobile in a short while. “Panchal followed her instructions and within minutes Rs 30,000 and Rs 15,000 were debited from his account in two transactions. The money went to two digital wallets and we will soon apprehend the accused,” said a cybercrime cell official.

Title: RTC plans energy saving measures
Content:
Vijayawada: In a bid to modernise bus stations across the state, Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (APSRTC) to launch a pilot project at Tirupati along with Andhra Pradesh State Energy Efficiency Development Corporation (APSEEDCO).

The project will be implemented in a phased manner in all 128 depots and 10 major bus stations.

The modernisation project is aimed at introducing energy efficiency measures which will ease financial burden by way of reducing consumption, said the energy department in a statement on Sunday. APSRTC is using about 30 million units of power every year and spending about Rs 28 crore for the same. The energy efficiency measures include replacing all incandescent bulbs and conventional tube lights with Light Emitting Diode (LED) lights, inefficient fans and old air conditioners with Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE) star rated appliances. Replacing all old appliances not only reduce cost on power consumption but also enhance the visual appeal of the bus stations the statement said.

APSEEDCO will conduct a detailed study on energy consumption pattern across all bus stations and depots and come up with a road map of energy efficient measures suited for APSRTC.

Title: Infighting in Rayalaseema new worry for YSRC
Content:
The party leadership believes it has consolidated its position in the Rayalaseema region after chief minister ... Read More

AMARAVATI: The YSRC leadership is struggling to contain infighting in Rayalaseema districts at a time when the party is grappling with issues such as three capital cities and abolition of the legislative council. The legislators are, however, not hesitant to come out in open to lash out at their rivals within the party.

Political observers say the trend is likely to spread to new constituencies and reverse the party’s prospects in the local body elections if the YSRC leadership fails to broker peace between warring factions. The party leadership believes it has consolidated its position in the Rayalaseema region after chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s decision to make Kurnool the judicial capital.

Faction feuds took an ugly turn in Kurnool district when followers of Nandikotkur MLA Arthur issued an ultimatum to district in-charge minister Anil Kumar Yadav to stop encouraging rivals in the party. They warned the minister that they would not allow him to tour Kurnool district if he did not clear the names to constitute agriculture market committee as recommended by Arthur. Sources said the clout of youth leader Byreddy Siddartha Reddy is worrying the Arthur group.

Title: Six UP wetlands declared Ramsar sites this year
Content:
Rare bird species spotted in Sandi wetland in Hardoi

LUCKNOW: The state is walking the extra mile to protect its wetlands. Six of them have been declared Ramsar sites this year and UP’s first Wetlands Authority has begun notifying wetlands lying both inside and outside forests.

A Ramsar site is a wetland designated to be of international importance under the Ramsar Convention signed in Iran in 1971.

Out of 37 wetlands declared Ramsar sites in India, now seven belong to UP. The list includes Nawabganj in Unnao, Parvati Aranga in Gonda, Saman in Mainpuri , Samaspur in Rae Bareli, Sandi in Hardoi and Sarsai Nawar in Etawah, which have made it to the list this year. The upper Ganga river, the stretch from Brigghat to Narora, is the state’s first Ramsar site, declared in 2005.

Sources in the government said while the Ramsar tag may not bring funds for conservation , but it was enough to secure international spotlight. “The declaration makes clear that six wetlands have met international scientific and technical parameters,” said a source.

The declaration comes at a time the state government has constituted UP’s first Wetlands Authority which, sources said, is still in a nascent stage. “The authority will identify and prepare a wetland atlas for the state, including the ones lying outside forest. The process to notify Ramgarh Taal has started. It lies outside forest,” a source said.

UP has around 1.2 lakh wetlands that lie outside forests and around 500 that lie within. According to the national wetland atlas that is based on satellite data, out of the 1.2 lakh in UP at least 23,800 are more than 2.2 hectare in area and need conservation. However, going by revenue records, UP has at least 26,000 wetlands that are bigger than 2.2 hectare.

Once the wetlands are notified, they will be covered under the Wildlife Protection Act. Conservation efforts will also involve developing a connect between people and wetlands such as promoting eco-tourism, fisheries and other economic activities.

Wetlands are shallow water bodies spread over an area of at least 3 hectare or those with water as deep as 30cm for a period of six months. It is the changing land-use pattern that is the biggest threat to wetlands.

Title: M Jagadesh Kumar: JNU VC to head Madras university VC search panel, faculty not happy
Content:
M Jagadesh Kumar

CHENNAI: Jawaharlal Nehru University vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar has been nominated to the panel to search for a new vice-chancellor for University of Madras by governor Banwarilal Purohit, who is its chancellor. Sources from the university confirmed the nomination and said he would be the convenor of the search panel.

The nomination has surprised the university faculty since professor Jagadesh Kumar’s tenure at JNU has been mired in controversies. They also said the professor should not be given the task of short-listing a new vice-chancellor for Madras University since he has an engineering background.

A senior professor from the university, who did not want his name revealed, urged the governor to nominate a person with non-controversial background and some understanding of issues pertaining to Madras University. “Ever since his appointment as vice-chancellor of JNU, students have been protesting against decisions taken by his administration. He even refused to meet student representatives following an attack by hooligans on students inside the campus. He is also known to be close to the ruling party at the Centre. If that’s the case, how can we expect a neutral person to be nominated as VC,” he asked.
